{{About|the 2002 game|the 1993 game|DinoPark Tycoon}} {{unreferenced|date=January 2009}} {{Infobox video game |title = Dino Island |image = DinoIslandBoxArt.png |developer = [[Monte Cristo (company)|Monte Cristo]] |publisher = [[Wanadoo Edition]] (Europe)
[[Strategy First]] (North America) |designer = Yanik Buttner, Jérôme Cukier, Nicolas Frémont |engine = |released = May 22, 2002 ([[France]])
June 7, 2002 ([[UK]])
October 10, 2002 ([[North America|NA]]) |genre = [[Business simulation game]] |modes = [[Single-player]] |platforms = [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] }} '''''Dino Island''''' (also known as '''''Dino Tycoon''''') is a 2002 PC [[business simulation game|business simulation]] [[video game]] developed and published by [[Monte Cristo (company)|Monte Cristo]]. ==Story== In a more or less near future, scientists have managed to recreate dinosaurs. In order to fund research, government has set up [[dinosaur]]-themed [[amusement parks]] that the player will manage. ==Gameplay== ''Dino Island'' is a theme park simulator not unlike [[Theme Park (computer game)|''Theme Park'']], ''[[Roller Coaster Tycoon]]'', or even ''[[Zoo Tycoon]]''. However, it is rendered in full 3D - players can rotate, pan and zoom at will. Dinosaurs, staff and visitors are fully animated. The game uses a typical point and click and menu interface. ===Breeding dinosaurs=== In ''Dino Island'', there are 20 pure, historical dinosaur species, including ''[[Tyrannosaurus rex]]'', ''[[Troodon]]'', ''[[Giganotosaurus]]'', ''[[Parasaurolophus]]'', ''[[Iguanodon]]'', ''[[Ankylosaurus]]'', and ''[[Pachycephalosaurus]]''. The dinosaurs are classified in 6 families: large carnivorous, armored quadrupeds, light bipeds, etc. The player can mix any two dinosaurs to create a new one. The resulting creature will be a [[genetics|genetic]] mix of its parents: it will inherit features from both of them, based on [[Dominance relationship|genetic dominance]]. Each dinosaur is made of many parts: legs, arms, head, etc. Each part of the resulting dinosaur will also be a mix between that of its parents. For instance, the mix of a ''[[Diplodocus]]'' and a ''[[Triceratops]]'' will have a head in between that of its parents. [[Mutation]]s can also occur, either accidentally or, when the player masters the technology, voluntarily. Mutations include feathers, extra horns, weird scales, and the like. ===Visitors=== Visitors also come in several categories, which all have likes and dislikes. For instance, kids like cute dinosaurs but do not like big ones, hooligans like to see dinosaur fights from up close but do not like peaceful dinosaurs, pensioners like diverse dinosaurs but not too much action, etc. Every item in the game, dinosaurs, attraction or park installation, radiates several attributes like comfort, fear or cuteness, which will attract or repel different visitor types. Visitors will move in the park according to their needs. For instance, if the player's park has many other older visitors, it is not a good idea to put a path to the feeding dish and the shops next to the most violent dinosaurs, as they will hesitate to go that way. ===Park management=== The game also has a light park management aspect. The player can build facilities that sell stuff, enclosures to put the dinosaurs in and has to manage staff that will feed the dinosaurs, among other things. As this was not the focus of the game, there are very few options in that department, compared to other games in that category. ==External links== *[http://www.gamethink.net/The-story-of-Dino-Island.html The Story of Dino Island], page about the development of the game by the producer *{{moby game|id=/dino-island}} [[Category:Windows games]] [[Category:Windows-only games]] [[Category:God games]] [[Category:2002 video games]] [[Category:Business simulation games]] [[Category:Dinosaurs in video games]] [[Category:Video games developed in France]]

revision.text:
[[File:Logo-ERC-702x264.jpg|thumb]] '''European Rover Challenge"", "ERC"''' – the biggest space – robotics event in Europe, dedicated to the scientific and business world, the new technology industry and the wide audience. Since 2014 ERC is organized each year in Poland at the initiative of the Polish branch of [[Mars Society|The Mars Society]].
The main core of ERC is international Mars rovers competition, destinated for students and recent graduates of higher education from all around the world. European Rover Challenge as well as [[University Rover Challenge]] (the American equivalent of this competition) is a part of Rover Challenge Series – the most prestigious robotics challenge league, powered by The Mars Society.
The aim of the European Rover Challenge is to encourage students of technical universities to develop their potential through participation in the prestigious competition. The ERC also performs a kind of mission: the promotion of talented engineers. Taking up the challenge of building the rover destined for [[Mars]] exploration which meets certain conditions specified in the rules of the competition and presenting the model in front of jury of experts in robotics, planetary geology, communication and cosmonautics is for young scientists a unique opportunity to develop their career. [[File:ERC 2015 Mars Rover Design Team Maintenance Task - Reactor Part I 9.JPG|thumb]] According to the ERC rules<ref>{{Cite web|title = Competition Rules|url = http://roverchallenge.eu/en/rules-2/|website = European Rover Challenge|access-date = 2016-02-14|language = en-EN}}</ref> there are a few tasks to complete by rover teams during the competition: # A science task involving obtaining and analyzing samples # A “blind” navigation task, in which the team will have to guide the rover to a certain destination using just GPS coordinates and no camera input # Two engineering tasks that will require using and repairing equipment # Presentation of the project in front of jury
During all of the tasks, the teams will have to control their rovers without seeing them directly.
== The ERC target audience == European Rover Challenge is an event aimed not only for the Mars rovers builders participating in the competition. Adding to the program some extra points, such as the science – technology conference, science presentations, expert’s lectures and meetings with special guests resulted in the interest of a very large and diverse target group. In 2014 in ERC took part 25 000 people, in the next edition - ERC 2015 - 30 000.
== The ERC history == European Rover Challenge is organized since 2014. Both organized editions (2014 and 2015) of the event have been held in Świętokrzyskie voivodeship, in the Regional Science–Technology Centre. In order to properly adapt the landscape to the character of the competition, each time to the place were transported over 750 tons of the red soil imitating the Red Planet cover. Since 2016 ERC is held in Congress and Exhibition Center in Podkarpackie voivodeship, Poland [[File:Harrison Shmitt on ERC.jpg|thumb]] Each year in the event take part special guests. In previous editions of ERC they were among others: dr [[Harrison Schmitt]] – Apollo 17 crew, prof. Scott Hubbard, ex. Head of NASA Ames, dr [[Robert Zubrin]], The Mars Society Founder and dr Gianfranco Visentin, Head of Automation and Robotics Section, [[European Space Agency]].<ref>{{Cite web|title = The Success of European Rover Challenge|url = http://www.planetary.org/blogs/guest-blogs/2015/1016-the-success-of-european-rover-challenge.html|website = www.planetary.org|access-date = 2016-02-14}}</ref> During ERC 2015 has been organized also a unique videomeeting with [[Andy Weir]], an American novelist, author of [[The Martian (Weir novel)|The Martian]].
== The Winners of European Rover Challenge ==
'''5–7 September 2014 - first edition - ERC 2014''' Number of competing teams: 9 (e.g. from India, Colombia, Egypt, Poland) * 1st place: SCORPIO, Wroclaw, Poland * 2nd place: Impulse, Kielce, Poland * 3rd place: Lunar and Mars Rover Team, Cairo, Egypt [[File:Canadian team with ERC medals.jpg|thumb]] '''4–6 September 2015 - the second edition - ERC 2015''' Number of competing teams: 29 (e.g. from US, Australia, India, Colombia, Netherlands, Egypt, Poland and Canada) * 1st place: USST, Canada * 2nd place: Next, Bialystok, Poland * 3rd place: McGill Robotics Canada

{{More citations needed|date=October 2015}} {{Infobox comic book title | title = Fade from Grace | image = Fade From Grace (front cover).gif | caption = Fade from Grace
TBP Comic book Cover | schedule = Monthly | format = |limited =y | publisher = [[Beckett Comics]] | date = August [[2004 in comics|2004]] - March [[2005 in comics|2005]] | issues = Five | main_char_team = John
Grace | writers = Gabriel Benson | artists = Jeff Amano | pencillers = | inkers = | colorists = | creative_team_month = | creative_team_year = | creators = Jeff Amano |subcat=Image Comics |sort=Fade From Grace }} '''Fade from Grace''' is a five-part [[Limited series (comics)|limited series]] written by [[Gabriel Benson]], and illustrated and created by [[Jeff Amano]]; it is published by [[Beckett Comics]]. ==Synopsis== John and Grace are an ordinary couple until John comes home one day to find his wife trapped inside their burning house. When John tries to save her, he discovers that he has superpowers. The mini-series focuses on the effects this has on their relationship, especially after John decides to take on the secret identity "Fade."{{Cite book|isbn = 978-1582405278|title = Fade from Grace |date = |website = |publisher = |last = |first = }} ==Publication history== Beckett Comics published the original five series run from August [[2004 in comics|2004]] to March [[2005 in comics|2005]]. The issues were later collected into a [[trade paperback (comics)|trade paperback]] in November 2005, and distributed by [[Image Comics]]. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.imagecomics.com/issue.php?item=848 Fade from Grace at Image Comics website] * * [[Category:2004 comics debuts]] [[Category:American comics titles]] {{comics-stub}}

[[File:Fake Shemp comic.jpg|thumb|350px|right]] '''Fake Shemp''', or simply '''Shemp''', is someone who appears in a film as a replacement for another actor or person. Their appearance is disguised using methods such as heavy make-up (or a computer-generated equivalent), filming from the back, dubbing in audio and splicing in past footage from the original actor's previous work, using a [[sound-alike]] [[voice actor]], or using partial shots of the actor. The concept is named after [[Shemp Howard]], whose sudden death in 1955 necessitated the use of these techniques to finish the films to which he was already committed. Once somewhat commonplace throughout the 20th century, the use of Fake Shemps to emulate living people is now forbidden under [[Screen Actors Guild]] contracts, largely because of a lawsuit filed by [[Crispin Glover]] that determined that the method violates the original actor's [[personality rights]]. The method continues to be used in cases, such as Shemp's, where the original actor is deceased and permission from the deceased actor's estate is granted.
A fake Shemp is distinguished from a [[stunt double]]. Stunt doubles usually only substitute for an actor in select scenes where the original actor is either unable to perform the stunt or is unwilling to take the risk of being injured in the stunt. The same techniques are often used for both.
==Origin== The term references the comedy trio [[The Three Stooges]]. On November 22, 1955, Stooge [[Shemp Howard]] died suddenly of a [[myocardial infarction|heart attack]] at age 60. At the time, the Stooges still had four shorts left to deliver (''[[Rumpus in the Harem]]'', ''[[Hot Stuff (1956 film)|Hot Stuff]]'', ''[[Scheming Schemers]]'', and ''[[Commotion on the Ocean]]''), by the terms of their annual contract with [[Columbia Pictures]]. By this point in the trio's career, budget cuts at Columbia had forced them to make heavy use of [[stock footage]] from previously completed shorts, so they were able to complete the films without Shemp. New footage was filmed of the other two Stooges ([[Moe Howard]] and [[Larry Fine]]) and edited together with stock footage. When continuity required that Shemp appear in the new scenes, they used Columbia supporting player [[Joe Palma]] to be a [[body double]] for him, often appearing only from behind or with an object obscuring his face.<ref>Lenburg, Jeff; Howard Maurer, Joan; Lenburg, Greg; (1982). ''The Three Stooges Scrapbook'', Citadel Press. {{ISBN|0-8065-0946-5}}</ref>
Palma is often mistakenly cited as Shemp's stand-in, but these four shorts are the only documented times he performed in this capacity. Palma was a [[bit player|bit character actor]] and was not employed as a stand-in or double during Shemp's lifetime. Shemp's stand-in was usually Harold Breen, and there were others from time to time. But these four shorts required someone to double as Shemp in an actor's capacity, not a stand-in as such; hence, director [[Jules White]] utilized character actor Palma, who had appeared as a supporting character in numerous ''Three Stooges'' shorts before Shemp's death and would continue in that capacity for the trio's shorts with [[Joe Besser]] as the third stooge. Palma became the original "Fake Shemp", although the term was not officially in use at the time.<ref name="stoogeology">{{cite book |last=Seely |first=Peter |last2=Pieper |first2=Gail W. |title=Stoogeology: Essays on the Three Stooges |year=2007 |publisher= McFarland |isbn=0-7864-2920-8 |page=78}}</ref>
==The Stooge films== ===''Rumpus in the Harem''=== For ''[[Rumpus in the Harem]]'', Palma is seen from the back several times. The first time occurs in the restaurant when Moe declares that the trio must do something to help their sweethearts. Larry then concludes the conversation by saying "I've got it, I've got it!" Moe inquires with "What?" Larry replies, "a terrific headache!" Later, Palma is seen from the back being chased in circles by the palace guard. A few lines of dialogue appear — "Whoa, Moe, Larry! Moe, help!" — by dubbing Shemp's voice from the soundtracks of ''[[Fuelin' Around]] ''and ''[[Blunder Boys]]''. Palma was later seen from the side when staring up at the Harem girls (they allowed half his face to be shown because he was farther from the camera than Moe or Larry).
Palma is seen one final time, making a mad dash for the open window, and supplying his own yell before making the final jump. This was one of the few times during his tenure as Shemp's double that Palma was required to speak without the aid of dubbing.
===''Hot Stuff''=== For ''[[Hot Stuff (1956 film)|Hot Stuff]]'', Palma is seen several times. The first time occurs when the Stooges, disguised in beards, are trolling through office hallways. Moe instructs Shemp to pursue a suspicious looking girl, to which Palma grunts "Right!" He then walks off-camera, allowing Moe and Larry to finish the scene by themselves. This is the only time Palma was shown from the front in a near shot, but since his secret agent character was wearing a fake beard at the time, his face was concealed.
Later, Palma is seen from the back while the boys are locked in the laboratory. Palma attempts to imitate Shemp's famed cry of "Heep, heep, heep!". Again, Moe directs Shemp, this time to guard the door. Palma obliges, mutters a few additional "Heep, heep, heeps!," and hides behind the door. This brief scene was the largest speaking part Palma performed in his own voice while acting as Shemp.
===''Scheming Schemers''=== For ''[[Scheming Schemers]]'', Palma appears for the shot of "Shemp" honking a truck horn. Palma gathers several pipes, obstructing his face, and one line of dialogue ("Hold yer horses, will ya?") is dubbed in Shemp's voice from [[The Ghost Talks (1949 film)|''The Ghost Talks'']]. Shemp is absent from several scenes. In one scene, Larry, upon hearing that a valuable piece of art has been stolen, whispers to Moe, "Where's Shemp? He loves pictures!" Moe mutters, "I think he's upstairs," explaining away Shemp's absence for the next few minutes.
===''Commotion on the Ocean''=== For ''[[Commotion on the Ocean]]'', Palma appears in only one new shot during the newspaper office scene. After Larry says, "Oh, I know Smitty: 'Under the spreading chestnut tree, the village smitty stands'," Moe slaps him. Palma gets involved in the slapstick exchange and shields himself in defense, obstructing his face.
Other new footage throughout the film consists of Moe and Larry working as a duo, often discussing Shemp's absence aloud:
*'''Moe''': "I wonder what became of that Shemp?" *'''Larry''': "You know he went on deck to scout out some food." *'''Moe''': "Oh, yeah. That's right."
==First usage== Aspiring filmmaker [[Sam Raimi]], a professed Stooges fan, coined the term in his first feature-length movie ''[[The Evil Dead]]''.<ref name=torstar>{{cite news | title = Should the Stooges get a little brighter?; New DVD lets viewers see colourized version Modern directors decry new-look numbskulls | author = David Germain | newspaper = Toronto Star | date = Aug 10, 2004 | page = D.08}}</ref> Most of his crew and cast abandoned the project after major delays (mostly due to budget issues) pushed production well beyond the scheduled six weeks. He was forced to use himself, his die-hard friends [[Bruce Campbell]], [[Rob Tapert]], [[Josh Becker]], assistant David Goodman, and brother [[Ted Raimi]] as "fake Shemps".<ref>Campbell, Bruce; (2001). ''If Chins Could Kill: Confessions of a B Movie Actor'', St. Martin's Press. {{ISBN|0-312-24264-6}}</ref>
Sam Raimi's later productions in film and TV have also often used the term to refer to stand-ins or nameless characters. For example, 15 fake Shemps were included in the credits for ''[[Army of Darkness]]'', Raimi's second sequel to ''The Evil Dead''.<ref name=philenq>{{cite news | title = A Trip Into the Macabre With 3 Stooges | author = staff | newspaper = Philadelphia Inquirer | date = February 19, 1993 | page = 03 (weekend features section)}}</ref> The description is sometimes modified in the final credits; in ''[[Darkman]]'', Bruce Campbell's quick [[Cameo appearance|cameo]] in the final scene is credited as "Final Shemp", and Campbell was also credited as "Shemp Wooley" (a pun on singer [[Sheb Wooley]]) when doing the voice of "Jean-Claude the Carrier Parrot" in the short-lived TV series ''[[Jack of All Trades (TV series)|Jack of All Trades]]''.
==Examples== There have been many Fake Shemps over the years. One of the earliest, in an example that predates its use to replace Shemp, was in the film ''[[Saratoga (film)|Saratoga]]'', in which the illness and death of star [[Jean Harlow]] necessitated the filming of scenes with a voice and body double. Director [[Ed Wood]] used his wife's chiropractor, Tom Mason, in the 1959 cult classic ''[[Plan 9 from Outer Space]]'' as a stand-in for the deceased [[Bela Lugosi]].
In the 1981 film ''[[Superman II]]'', actor [[Gene Hackman]], who had finished the majority of his scenes playing [[Lex Luthor]], left the project following the departure of the film's original director, [[Richard Donner]]. After replacement director [[Richard Lester]] took over production, a Shemp was used for Hackman to finish his remaining scenes. This was accomplished by an uncredited actor standing in for Hackman, though not ever facing the camera, while also impersonating Hackman's voice.
The death of actor [[John Candy]] forced the use of a fake Shemp to complete filming of ''[[Wagons East|Wagons East!]]''.<ref>[https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1957&dat=19940819&id=XAUxAAAAIBAJ&sjid=P-AFAAAAIBAJ&pg=3171,4419349] {{dead link|date=January 2017}}</ref>
Another example is from the 1989 film ''[[Back to the Future Part II]]''. Actor [[Crispin Glover]] was asked to reprise the role of George McFly. Glover indicated interest, but could not come to an agreement with the producers regarding his salary. For the George McFly character to appear, director [[Robert Zemeckis]] used some previously filmed footage of Glover from the first film and inter-spliced [[Jeffrey Weissman]], who wore prosthetics including a false chin, nose, and cheekbones and used various obfuscating methods, such as background, sunglasses, rear shot, and even upside-down, to resemble Glover. Dissatisfied with these plans, Glover filed a lawsuit against the producers, including Steven Spielberg, on the grounds that they neither owned his likeness nor had permission to use it. Due to Glover's lawsuit, there are now clauses in the [[Screen Actors Guild]] collective bargaining agreements that state that producers and actors are not allowed to use such methods to reproduce the likeness of other actors.<ref>{{cite interview |last=Glover |first=Crispin |subjectlink=Crispin Glover |interviewer=[[Simon Mayo]], [[Mark Kermode]] |title=Crispin Glover on Back to the Future 2 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5Q7wGsVYydo |via=YouTube video |work=Kermode & Mayo |publisher=[[BBC Radio 5 Live]] |location=London |date=February 2011 |accessdate=April 11, 2011}}<!-- This clip was uploaded by the official account of the BBC Radio 5Live program.--></ref>
==See also== * [[Alan Smithee]]
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *[https://web.archive.org/web/20071115162315/http://en.allexperts.com/q/Horror-Film-2863/Horror-Film-Staff.htm What is a Fake Shemp?]
See also ''Dark Horse Comic'', AOD #2 of 3, interview with Bruce Campbell

revision.text:
{{Redirect|Glove puppet||hand puppet}} {{refimprove|date=September 2012}} [[Image:Taiwan-Puppet-Monkey-god2.jpg|right|thumb|[[Sun Wukong]] puppet in pò·-tē-hì.]] '''Glove puppetry''' ({{zh|poj=pò͘-tē-hì|t=布袋戲|p=bùdàixì}})<ref>Also known as '''budai mu'ouxi''', '''shoucao kuileixi''', '''shoudai kuileixi''', '''chang-chung hsi''' ([[pinyin]]: zhǎngzhōngxì), '''xiaolong''', or '''zhihuaxi'''</ref> is a type of opera using cloth [[puppet]]s that originated during the 17th century in [[Quanzhou]] or [[Zhangzhou]] of [[China]]'s [[Fujian]] province, and historically practised in the [[Min Nan]]-speaking areas such as Quanzhou, Zhangzhou, the [[Chaoshan]] region of [[Guangdong]], and other parts of southern China. It had since established itself contemporarily as a popular art form in [[Taiwan]].
The puppet's head uses wood carved into the shape of a hollow human head, but aside from the head, palms, and feet, which are made of wood, the puppet's [[torso]] and limbs consist entirely of cloth costumes. At the time of the performance, a gloved hand enters the puppet's costume and makes it perform. In previous years the puppets used in this type of performance strongly resembled "cloth sacks," hence the name, which literally means "cloth bag opera."
==Glove puppetry performances== [[File:Handrama doll BlueButterfly.jpg|thumb|right|250px|A modern style of puppet in Taiwan glove puppetry.]] Glove puppetry (pò͘-tē-hì) performances, similar to some types of [[Chinese opera]], are divided into a first half and a second half show. During the first half, known as the "show platform" (戲台), the audience is shown a demonstration by a master puppeteer on the stage. The second half consists of the puppet master, the orchestra, and the spoken parts. Several key points of a show to be appreciated include: the dexterity of the master puppeteer's manipulation of the puppet, the accompaniment of the orchestra, and the poetic spoken parts of the [[voice actors]]. With few exceptions, from traditional pò͘-tē-hì to modern performances, human vocal music and operatic singing is rarely heard.
==Glove puppetry in Indonesia== [[File:Sie Djien Koei Potehi.JPG|thumb|right|Wayang Potehi of Indonesia]] In Indonesia, glove puppetry once popular throughout Chinese communities around Sumatra and Java. Especially in Java, the acculturation between Chinese and Javanese culture gave birth to new style of puppetry, called ''[[Peranakan]] Potehi''.<ref name="wayangpotehi1">[http://thejakartapostimages.weebly.com/photostory/potehi Potehi puppets bring celebratory mood], ''thejakartapostimages''. 30-05-2016</ref><ref name="wayangpotehi2">[http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2014/07/14/in-praise-puppets.html In praise of puppets], ''thejakartapost''. 30-05-2016</ref> Today, glove puppetry is called with the term "[[Wayang]] Potehi" (Wayang means "puppet" in Javanese). The Wayang Potehi tradition is mainly preserved in [[Central Java]] ([[Semarang]]) and [[East Java]]'s ({{ill|Gudo, Jombang|id}}) Chinese communities.<ref name="gudo potehi">{{id}}[http://travel.kompas.com/read/2014/10/02/194100427Seni.Wayang.Potehi.Berpusat.di.Gudo Seni Wayang Potehi Berpusat di Gudo (Center of Wayang Potehi in Gudo)]{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}, ''travel.kompas.com''. 30-05-2016</ref> Most of the dialog parts of Wayang Potehi have been narrated using Indonesian and [[Javanese language]].
==See also== * [[Chinese folk art]] * [[Hand puppet]] * [[Pili (TV series)]] * [[Legend of the Sacred Stone]] * [[Sooty]] * [[Harry Corbett]] * [[Thunderbolt Fantasy]]
==Notes== {{Reflist|colwidth=}}
==External links== *[http://www.unesco.org/culture/ich/en/Art18/00624 Strategy for training coming generations of Fujian puppetry practitioners]: [[Unesco]] Lists of intangible cultural heritage and Register of best safeguarding practices

revision.comment: Adding information from Parisian Sketches by J.K. Huysmans.
revision.text:
{{Refimprove|date=March 2008}} [[File:Harvard Theatre Collection - MS Thr 693 (68) - Circus images, l'eschelle preileuse - cropped.jpg|thumb|Thomas Hanlon performing, 1860]] A group of pre-Vaudevillian [[acrobatics|acrobats]] founded in the early 1840s, '''the Hanlon-Lees''' were world-renowned practitioners of "entortillation" (an invented word based upon the French term ''[[entortillage]]'', which translates to "twisting" or "coiling") – that is, tumbling, juggling, and an early form of "knockabout" comedy (later popularized by such groups as the Marx Brothers and the Three Stooges). The troupe consisted of the six Hanlon brothers and their mentor, established acrobat Professor John Lees.
Originally billed as "The Hanlons," the group debuted in 1846 at London's [[Adelphi Theatre|Theatre Royal, Adelphi]]. At this time, the company consisted of George, William, and Alfred Hanlon, who were essentially wards of John Lees until his death in 1855. After his demise, the Hanlons returned to England and enlisted their younger brothers – Thomas, Edward, and Frederick – and rechristened themselves "The Hanlon-Lees" in honor of their fallen friend and instructor.
The newly expanded troupe made its American debut in 1858 at [[Niblo's Garden]] in New York City, and spent the next four decades touring the United States and Europe. As their skills improved, their performances became more elaborate. When Jules Léotard introduced the trapeze in 1859, for instance, the Hanlon-Lees quickly adapted to the new device; their next production, ''Le Voyage en Suisse'' (''A Trip to Switzerland'') contained an aerial juggling sequence that stunned [[Émile Zola]], who expressed utter astonishment at the vast number of airborne objects. There is a spectacular poster by Jules Chéret, the great pioneer of the classic era of French poster design, advertising their appearance at the Folies Bergères in 1878. In addition, the company is referred to in J.K. Huysmans chapter: "The Folies-Bergere in 1879" in his book Parisian Sketches, first published in France in 1880: "these side-splitting, yet funereal, clowns, the Hanlon-Lees.".
The Hanlon-Lees also patented several inventions, including the aerial safety net and a wooden brace used in the construction of scenery (which is to this day referred to as a "[[hanlon]]").
Despite the death of Thomas in 1868, the group continued to perform regularly until the early 1900s, at which point George Hanlon's sons Will and Fred assumed control of the company's repertoire. They would carry the company successfully into the 20th Century, going so far as to appear on film for [[Thomas Edison]] in a production entitled ''Fantasma''. The Hanlons would endure for another four decades, adapting their acts for vaudeville and finally appearing in the 1945 season of the [[Ringling Brothers and Barnum & Bailey Circus]].
In 1979, six American performers sought out the final living descendant of the original Hanlon brothers and asked for her blessing upon their new company, dubbed the [[Hanlon-Lees Action Theater]]. This modern incarnation of the original troupe is best known for pioneering and refining a theatrical form of medieval jousting, an event which the company continues to perform at Renaissance festivals in the United States. The modern day Hanlon-Lees also perform Western-themed shows such as fantasy rodeos and cowboy exhibitions.
== References == *Cosdon, Mark. (2009 and occasional updates). [http://www.siupress.com/downloads/excerpts/9780809329250_expt.pdf "A Chronological Outline of the Hanlon Brothers, 1833 - 1931."] *Cosdon, Mark. (2009). ''The Hanlon Brothers: From Daredevil Acrobatics to Spectacle Pantomime, 1833 - 1931,'' Theatre in the Americas Series, Southern Illinois University Press. *Cosdon, Mark. (2000). "Prepping for Pantomime: The Hanlon Brothers Fame and Tragedy, 1833- 1870. ''Theatre History Studies,'' Volume 20 (2000): 67 - 104. *Cosdon, Mark. (2006). "'Serving the Purpose Amply:'" The Hanlon Brothers 'Le Voyage en Suisse.'" ''The Journal of American Drama and Theatre'', Volume 18, no. 2 (Spring 2006): 71 - 100. *Huysmans, J.K. (1880) Parisian Sketches, France, 1880. Republished by Dedalus, 2004. *McKinven, John A. (1998). ''The Hanlon Brothers: Their Amazing Acrobatics, Pantomimes and Stage Spectacles'', David Meyer Magic Books. *Towsen, John H. (1976). ''Clowns'', E.P. Dutton.
[[Category:Acrobats]] [[Category:British circus performers]] [[Category:American circus performers]]

{{Infobox film | name = Houdini | image = File: Houdini_DVD_Cover.png | image_size = | caption = DVD Cover | director = Pen Densham | producer = Leanna Moore | writer = Pen Densham | narrator = | starring = Johnathon Schaech

David Warner | music = Don Harper | cinematography = Gordon Lonsdale | editing = William Hoy | studio = | distributor = [[TNT (U.S. TV network)|TNT]] | released = 6 December 1998 | runtime = 99 mins | country = USA | language = English }} '''''Houdini''''' is a 1998 television film about the life of the magician [[Harry Houdini]], directed and written by [[Pen Densham]]. It stars [[Johnathon Schaech]], [[Stacy Edwards]], [[Paul Sorvino]] and [[David Warner (actor)|David Warner]]. It debuted on the [[TNT Network]] in December 1998.{{cite web|url=http://www.tcm.com/tcmdb/title/326689/Houdini/ |title=Houdini (1998) - Overview |publisher=TCM.com |date=2009-12-02 |accessdate=2013-12-01}}{{cite web|url=http://www.movieweb.com/movie/houdini-1998 |title=Houdini (1998) |publisher=Movieweb.com |date= |accessdate=2013-12-01}} ==Plot== The film details the life, relationships and exploits of the famous magician. ==Cast== * [[Johnathon Schaech]] as [[Harry Houdini]] * [[Emile Hirsch]] as Young Houdini * [[Stacy Edwards]] as Bess Houdini * [[Paul Sorvino]] as Blackburn * [[Rhea Perlman]] as Esther * [[David Warner (actor)|David Warner]] as [[Sir Arthur Conan Doyle]] * [[Mark Ruffalo]] as Theo * [[Grace Zabriskie]] as Mrs. Weiss * [[Ron Perlman]] as Booking Agent * [[Karl Makinen]] as Jim Collins * [[Judy Geeson]] as Lady Doyle * [[George Segal]] as Beck ==Home release== The DVD is available as part of the burn-on-demand [[Warner Archive]] service.{{cite web|author= |url=http://shop.warnerarchive.com/product/houdini+1000412546.do?sortby=ourPicks&refType=&from=fn |title=Houdini |publisher=Shop.warnerarchive.com |date=2013-10-16 |accessdate=2013-12-01}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0159276/?ref_=nv_sr_4 ''Houdini''] at [[the Internet Movie Database]] *[http://www.tcm.com/tcmdb/title/326689/Houdini/ ''Houdini''] at TCM *[http://shop.warnerarchive.com/product/houdini+1000412546.do?sortby=ourPicks&refType=&from=fn ''Houdini''] at Warner Archive [[Category:American biographical films]] [[Category:American films]] [[Category:1998 television films]] [[Category:Films about magic and magicians]] [[Category:TNT Network original films]] [[Category:Cultural depictions of Harry Houdini]] {{US-tv-film-stub}} {{bio-film-stub}}

{{fringe theories|date=July 2016}} '''Ideokinesis''' is an approach to improving posture, alignment, and fluency of movement through structured [[guided imagery]]<ref>{{citation|title=Exercise-Induced Central Fatigue A Review of the Literature with Implications for Dance Science Research|last=Batson|first=Glenna|year=2013|journal=Journal of Dance Medicine & Science|volume=17|issue=2|pages=53–62|pmid=23759479|doi=10.12678/1089-313X.17.2.53}}</ref> that uses metaphors, such as visualizing an object moving in a specific direction along various muscle groups throughout the body, while lying completely still.<ref>{{citation|first1=Eveline|last1=Golomer|first2=Arnaud|last2=Bouillette, et al.|date=July 2008|title=Effects of Mental Imagery Styles on Shoulder and Hip Rotations During Preparation of Pirouettes|journal=Journal of Motor Behavior|volume=40|issue=4|pages=281–290|pmid=18628105|doi=10.3200/JMBR.40.4.281-290}}</ref><ref>{{citation|first=Brenda|last=Farnell|date=Spring 1986|title=Introduction to Martin's Article: 'Sweigard's Legacy: Further Explorations into Breathing'|journal=Journal for the Anthropological study of human movement|volume=4|issue=1|pages=14–15|url=http://jashm.press.illinois.edu/4.1/4-1Introduction_Farnell14-17.pdf|accessdate=12 July 2016}}</ref> Proponents claim that repeated practice of this particular formula of mental imagery translates to improved coordination in dance and in movement in general<ref>{{citation|title=Somatics in Action: How 'I Feel Three-Dimensional and Real' Improves Dance Education and Training|last=Kearns|first=Lauren W.|year=2010|journal=Journal of Dance Education|volume=10|issue=2|pages=35–40|doi=10.1080/15290824.2010.10387158|url=http://www.tandfonline.com/doi/pdf/10.1080/15290824.2010.10387158}}</ref> "based on the idea that imagery can improve skeletal alignment and posture through the re-patterning of neuromuscular pathways in the absence of overt movement".<ref name=Pavlik>{{citation|title=Imagery in Dance A Literature Review|last1=Pavlik|first1=Katherine|last2=Nordin-Bates|first2=Sanna|year=2016|journal=Journal of Dance Medicine & Science|volume=20|issue=2|pages=51–63|pmid=27245944|doi=10.12678/1089-313X.20.2.51}}</ref> Although there is some evidence that rehearsal-style mental imagery may benefit performance in sports, there is currently insufficient data to draw conclusions on the effectiveness of metaphorical imagery as only personal and experimental research has been conducted on ideokinesis and there are reasons to believe it may be contraindicated as a relaxation technique.<ref name=Pavlik/>
Ideokinesis was originally developed as a form of mental practice for injured dancers,<ref>{{citation|first=Pamela|last=Matt|title=Pioneers: Lulu E. Sweigard|work=Ideokinesis.com|url=http://www.ideokinesis.com/pioneers/sweigard/sweigard.htm|accessdate=12 July 2016}}</ref> but some dance schools have integrated it into a standard [[somatics]] protocol for all dancers because it is thought to optimize motor control and performance by using periods of rest constructively.<ref>{{citation|title=Teaching at the Interface of Dance Science and Somatics|last1=Geber|first1=Pamela|last2=Wilson|first2=Margaret|year=2010|journal=Journal of Dance Medicine & Science|volume=14|issue=2|pages=52–53|pmid=20507721}}</ref> Known among followers as "the Work",<ref name=Rosen>{{citation|title=Imaginary Movements: Transform your body and your yoga practice with these nine visualizations from the ideokinesis system - all without moving a muscle|last=Rosen|first=Richard|date=1 April 1998|journal=Yoga Journal|issue=139|pages=79–87|issn=0191-0965}}</ref> "ideokinesis" is sometimes used interchangeably with other terms, such as "mental practice", "mental rehearsal", "visuomotor behavior rehearsal", "covert rehearsal", and "ideokinetic facilitation", among others.<ref>{{citation|title=Motor imagery for stroke rehabilitation: current research as a guide to clinical practice|last=Batson|first=G|year=2004|journal=Alternative & Complementary Therapies|volume=10|issue=2|pages=84–89|doi=10.1089/107628004773933325|url=http://online.liebertpub.com/doi/pdf/10.1089/107628004773933325}}</ref>
[[Mabel Elsworth Todd|Mabel Todd]] conceived the ideokinesis approach; Barbara Clark and Lulu Sweigard,<ref name="Franklin">{{cite book |last=Franklin|first=Eric|title=Dynamic Alignment Through Imagery|origyear=1996|year=2012|location=Champaign, IL|publisher=Human Kinetics|isbn=9780736067898|pages=4, 6–7, 277|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=CBwV_g8DhEMC&lpg=PP1&dq=%22Dynamic%20alignment%20through%20imagery%22&pg=PA6#v=onepage&q&f=false}}</ref> and others contributed to its early evolution;<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ideokinesis.com/pioneers/intro/pioneers_intro.htm |title=Pioneers |author= |date= |work= |publisher= |accessdate=19 May 2011}}</ref> later, André Bernard, Irene Dowd, Erick Hawkins, Pamela Matt, [[Eric Franklin]] and others lent their influence.<ref name="Franklin"/>
Sweigard borrowed the word ''ideokinesis'', composed by two Greek words: ideo (thought) and kinesis (movement), from Bonpensière, a piano teacher, who applied imagery to his methodology. Ideokinesis can be translated roughly as "the image or thought as facilitator of movement".<ref>[http://www.worldcat.org/title/ideokinesis-creative-body-alignment-an-introduction-to-ideokinesis/oclc/37473981&referer=brief_results/ Bernard. A. ''An introduction to Ideokinesis'']</ref>

[[File:Julius-adler-talmudist-rakov.jpg|thumb|Julius Adler in Nokhum Rakov's ''Talmud Khokhem'']] '''Julius Adler''' (September 23, 1906 – December 28, 1994)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=pv&GRid=14314069&PIpi=3163335|title=photo of Julius and Henrietta Adler tombstone, Mount Hebron Cemetery, Flushing, NY|publisher=Find A Grave|accessdate=26 March 2011}}</ref> was a Jewish actor, writer, and director in [[Yiddish theater]].
==Career== He was born in [[Biłgoraj]], [[Poland]] into an [[Orthodox Judaism|orthodox Jewish]] family. When his father died six years later his mother emigrated to America leaving the children with grandparents. In 1920 the family was reunited in the United States and Julius began to work in theater.<ref name=Forward/> He played with Julius Natanson, Leon Blank, [[Boris Thomashevsky]], [[Aaron Lebedeff]], Samuel Goldenberg, [[Jennie Goldstein]], and others.<ref name=zalmen>Zalmen Zylbercweig, ''Leksikon fun Yidishn teater'', Book three, 2379</ref> He originally trained as a hat maker; when his stepfather learned of his desire to become an actor, Adler was put out of the family home. He got as far as the fire escape where he slept and where his mother gave him food. When Adler's stepfather learned about the amount of money his stepson was making in his acting career, he was invited to move back into the family apartment.<ref name=Bruce>{{cite web|url=http://articles.mcall.com/2005-04-10/entertainment/3611303_1_yiddish-theater-molly-picon-vaudeville|title=Yiddish theater star revels in the colorful continuity of his ethnic roots|date=10 April 2005|author=Outwater, Myra Yellin|publisher=Morning Call|accessdate=26 March 2011}}</ref>
==Later life and career== In 1935, he met Henrietta Jacobson<ref>{{cite web|url=https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=940DE1DA153EF931A25753C1A96E948260 |title=Henrietta Jacobson, A Yiddish Actress, 82 |date=12 October 1988 |publisher=New York Times |accessdate=2 April 2011 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5xe5WvTTQ?url=http://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=940DE1DA153EF931A25753C1A96E948260 |archivedate= 2 April 2011 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> while both were appearing with [[Herman Yablokoff]] (Hayim Yablonik) in McKinley Square Theater. She was a divorcee with a young son from a prior marriage.<ref name=Interview>{{cite news|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=S_wLAAAAIBAJ&sjid=MlcDAAAAIBAJ&pg=2514,473146&dq=julius+adler&hl=en|title=On-Stage Talent Upstaged Only By Off-Stage Warmth|author=Caffery, Bertha|date=3 September 1969|publisher=The Evening Independent|accessdate=26 March 2011}}</ref> Henrietta had deep roots in the Jewish theater community. Her parents, Joseph and Bessie, were Yiddish theater stars at the beginning of the 20th century, and her brothers, [[Hymie Jacobson|Hymie]] and Irving, not only performed but owned several prominent [[Yiddish]] theaters in New York City.<ref name=Bruce/> When her father died, Henrietta was just seven weeks old; Bessie continued to perform and brought her four children up as performers also.<ref name=Interview/> Julius and Henrietta formed a team and performed together for three years. When they had an offer to perform in [[Belgium]], Julius proposed by remarking that they could save money on visas and other expenses as a married couple. Henrietta accepted and they were married in 1938.<ref name=Interview/>
Adler was accepted into the [[Hebrew Actors Union]]<!-- Older than Equity and didn't fold until 2002, when its president, Seymour Rexite, died.--> in 1938 and with his wife toured [[France]], [[Lithuania]], and [[Belgium]]. They then played in Chicago, then at the Hopkonson Theater and made a revue film. They played with [[Molly Picon]] and [[Jacob Kalich]] at the [[Second Avenue (Manhattan)|Second Avenue Theater]] in the [[Yiddish Theater District]];<ref>{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/?id=QAEEAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA57&dq=julius+adler+yiddish+theater#v=onepage&q=julius%20adler%20yiddish%20theater&f=false|title=Off-Broadway Review: Sadie is a Lady|date=11 March 1950|publisher=Billboard|accessdate=26 March 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/?id=Lg4EAAAAMBAJ&pg=PT24&dq=julius+adler+yiddish+theater#v=onepage&q=julius%20adler%20yiddish%20theater&f=false|title=Off-Broadway Review: Abi Gesunt|date=22 October 1949|publisher=Billboard|accessdate=26 March 2011}}</ref> in 1948 they played in London. In 1950 he became director of the [[National Theater (Yiddish)|National Theater]] and produced Yiddish [[vaudeville]]. The couple also wrote plays.<ref name=Bruce/> Their son, [[Bruce Adler]] (Borekh Yosl, born 1944) played Yiddish theater when he was young.<ref name=zalmen /> He also later worked on Broadway and was nominated for two [[Tony Award]]s.<ref name=Forward>{{cite web|url=http://www.forward.com/articles/13862/|title=Bruce Adler, 63, Star of Broadway and Second Avenue|date=29 July 2008|author=Gerstein, Lana|publisher=Jewish Daily Forward|accessdate=26 March 2011}}</ref> The Adler family played the [[London Palladium]] with [[Sophie Tucker]] in the 1950s.<ref name=Bruce/>
Adler also did some work in films, beginning in 1926 with ''Broken Hearts''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0016684/fullcredits#cast|title=Broken Hearts|year=1926|publisher=IMDB|accessdate=26 March 2011}}</ref> He had an uncredited role as the High Priest in the 1935 film, ''[[She (1935 film)|She]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0026983/fullcredits#cast|title=She|year=1935|publisher=IMDB|accessdate=26 March 2011}}</ref> Adler was cast as Aleksei (the priest) for the film ''[[Tevya (film)|Tevya]]'' (1939). The musical ''[[Fiddler on the Roof]]'' was based on this film, though this early version of the story was non-musical.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0032012/|title=Tevya|year=1939|publisher=IMDB|accessdate=26 March 2011}}</ref> His last film role was as a comedian in the 1950 ''Catskill Honeymoon'',<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0042320/|title=Catskill Honeymoon|year=1950|publisher=IMDB|accessdate=26 March 2011}}</ref>
Adler and his wife were performing in non-Yiddish theater by the 1960s.<ref name=Interview/> In 1973, they were the stars of a [[St. Petersburg, Florida]] production of ''[[Come Blow Your Horn]]''. Their son, Bruce, was also cast in the play as the younger brother.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=5vYeAAAAIBAJ&sjid=JY0EAAAAIBAJ&pg=4968,198311&dq=julius+adler&hl=en|title='Blow Your Horn' at St. Peterburg|date=1 May 1973|publisher=Sarasota Journal|accessdate=26 March 2011}}</ref>
==Death== The couple is buried in the Yiddish Theatrical Alliance section (Block 67) of [[Mount Hebron Cemetery (New York City)|Mount Hebron Cemetery]]. The section is reserved for those who were part of New York's Yiddish theater and is maintained by the Alliance.<ref name=nytimes2>{{cite news|first=Corey |last=Kilgannon |title=Yiddish Theater Bids Farewell to Shifra Lerer |url=http://cityroom.blogs.nytimes.com/2011/03/15/yiddish-theater-bids-farewell-to-shifra-lerer/?scp=2&sq=shifra%20lerer&st=cse |work=[[New York Times]] |publisher= |date=2011-03-15 |accessdate=2011-03-20 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5xe3Pb9lI?url=http://cityroom.blogs.nytimes.com/2011/03/15/yiddish-theater-bids-farewell-to-shifra-lerer/?scp=2 |archivedate= 2 April 2011 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.museumoffamilyhistory.com/cp-yta.htm|title=Yiddish Theatrical Alliance-names of those buried in YTA cemetery sections|publisher=Museum of Family History|accessdate=2 April 2011}}</ref>

revision.text:
{{Infobox YouTube personality | name = Meg Turney | image = Lazer Team premiere - Meg Turney (26829459324) (cropped).jpg | caption = Turney at the 2015 [[Fantastic Fest]] | channel_name = megturney | views = 23.6 million | birth_name = Megan LeAnn Turney | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1987|3|12}} | birth_place = [[Austin, Texas]], U.S. | nationality = American | residence = [[Austin, Texas]], U.S. | website = | pseudonym = | occupation = {{flatlist| *[[Internet celebrity|Internet personality]] *[[cosplay]]er *[[Model (people)|model]] *[[Video blog|vlogger]]}} | height = {{convert|5|ft|2|in|cm|order=flip|abbr=on}} | partner = [[Kevin Pereira]] (2010–2012)
[[Gavin Free]] (2013–present) | years_active = 2012–present | genre = [[Video blog|vlog]] | subscribers = 340,000+ | network = None | associated_acts = {{flatlist| * ''[[SourceFed]]'' * ''[[Rooster Teeth]]'' }} | silver_year = 2013 | gold_year = | diamond_year = | ruby_year = | stats_update= June 3, 2013 | silver_button = yes | gold_button = no | diamond_button = | ruby_button = }} '''Megan LeeAnn Turney'''{{sfn|Turney|2010}} (born March 12, 1987) is an American internet personality, [[cosplay]]er, model, and vlogger. She became an internet personality through her hosting work, formerly with ''[[SourceFed]]'' and [[Rooster Teeth]]'s ''[[Rooster Teeth#The Know|The Know]]''. She also maintains a personal [[YouTube]] channel where she posts weekly [[vlogs]]. In addition to her work with online media, Turney has also earned notability for her cosplaying at various conventions such as [[San Diego Comic-Con International|Comic-Con]]. ==Media career== ===Career beginnings and ''SourceFed'' (2012–2014)=== During her early years of her online media career, Turney hosted event coverage for [[deviantART]]{{sfn|"Free Play"|2015}} and appeared as a featured host on [[CraveOnline]]'s ''TechKnow'' show.{{sfn|Milani|2012}} In July 2012, Turney would break through as an online media host, making her debut appearance on ''[[SourceFed]]'', alongside [[Steve Zaragoza]], in which the two discussed ''[[Star Wars]]'', [[San Diego Comic-Con International|Comic-Con]], and cosplaying.{{sfn|Zaragoza|Turney|2012}} Later that year Turney was alongside [[Elliott Morgan]] and [[Philip DeFranco]] during SourceFed's videos for [[YouTube]]'s "Election Hub."{{sfn|Gutelle|2012}} In February 2013, Turney and her ''SourceFed'' co-hosts won an Audience Choice [[Streamy Awards|Streamy Award]] for Series of the Year.{{sfn|Hill|2013}} Along with being a co-host of the channel, Turney was also a writer for the ''SourceFed'' website.{{sfn|Turney|n.d.a}} Turney would remain a host of the channel, as well as its ''Nerd'' spinoff,{{sfn|Cohen|2013}} until April 2014, when she announced she would be leaving ''SourceFed''.{{sfn|Turney|2014}}{{sfn|Cohen|2014}} During her time with ''SourceFed'', Turney appeared as a host of other series including the [[American Music Awards|AMA]]'s ''On Demand'',{{sfn|Billboard Staff|2012a}}{{sfn|Billboard Staff|2012b}} as well as ''[[Nerdist News]]''.{{sfn|Gutelle|2014a}} Additionally, in August 2013, Turney discussed [[Cinema of the United States|Hollywood]] portrayals about [[life on Mars]], alongside [[Bobak Ferdowsi]], [[Matt Mira]], and [[Vsauce#Vsauce2|Kevin Lieber]].{{sfn|Lazar|2013}} ===''Rooster Teeth'' (2014–2016)=== After departing from ''SourceFed'', Turney was announced as a new host for [[Rooster Teeth]]'s news channel, ''The Know'', on May 30, 2014.{{sfn|Jarvey|2014}} On joining Rooster Teeth, Turney claimed, "They have been pioneers in the industry for many years, and their level of originality and just plain fun in their content is unmatched in the space."{{sfn|Jarvey|2014}} On June 1, 2014, Turney made her first appearance on ''The Know''.{{sfn|Gutelle|2014a}} In July 2014, Rooster Teeth distributed the music video for "Did I Say That Out Loud?" by [[Barenaked Ladies]], in which Turney portrays the exasperated girlfriend of [[Gavin Free]]'s character.{{sfn|Gutelle|2014b}} In August 2014, Turney began co-hosting ''The Know It All: Leaderboard'', a collaborative series between [[Rooster Teeth]] and ''[[The Daily Dot]]''.{{sfn|Gallaga|2014}}{{sfn|Renovitch|2014}} Turney also voiced [[List of RWBY characters#Atlas Academy of Atlas|Neon Katt]] in the animated series ''[[RWBY]]'',{{sfn|Croswynd|2015}} and was a regular host on [[The Patch (podcast)|The Patch]], Rooster Teeth's weekly gaming podcast. On June 27, 2016, Turney announced that she had left Rooster Teeth on good terms.{{sfn|Turney|2016}} ===Twitch.tv controversy=== Turney was involved in a controversy when live [[streaming video]] website [[Twitch.tv]] updated its rules of conduct telling users to not shoot videos in "lingerie, swimsuits, pasties, and undergarments".{{sfn|Brouwer|2014}}{{sfn|Beres|2014}} Some news websites reported that Turney was the first user banned for violating the updated rules of conduct.{{sfn|Johnston|2014}} Turney clarified on [[Twitter]], stating, "Dear everyone writing articles saying I was banned from Twitch, I wasn't. I've never been banned. I was told to change my picture," adding "while we're on the subject I've never done any 'sexy broadcasts'. I've never even streamed from that account."{{sfn|Brouwer|2014}} Additionally, Turney also provided her opinion that the rule was not unfair to women, but just unfair in general, stating, "If someone has a big push-up bra and a low-cut shirt while they play [''[[League of Legends]]''] or a guy streams shirtless, who cares?"{{sfn|Beres|2014}} In June 2017, Turney began [[video game live streaming|streaming]] on Twitch.{{sfn|Turney|n.d.b}} ==Cosplaying and modeling== Through a friend's invitation to [[Ushicon|Ushicon 1]], Turney was introduced to cosplaying and anime conventions in 2002.{{sfn|"Cosplay Friday"|2012}} Turney's first cosplay was of [[Shadow Galactica#Sailor Heavy Metal Papillon|Sailor Heavy Metal Papillon]] from the anime, ''[[Sailor Moon]]''.{{sfn|Gee|2016}} On her first cosplay, Turney recalled, "I failed terribly. I couldn’t make half the costume, it was incredibly difficult, but I was as happy as a clam."{{sfn|Gee|2016}} Since then, Turney has become recognized for her cosplaying, in addition to her online media career;{{sfn|Hookway|2015}} ''Gamer Headlines'' described Turney as being, "known for her high quality cosplay and saucy lingerie photos."{{sfn|Sales|2014}} Turney's [[Princess Leia]], [[List of Cowboy Bebop characters#Faye Valentine|Faye Valentine]], and [[Psycho (Borderlands character)|Psycho]] cosplays have been particularly noted by various online publications.{{sfn|Milani|2012}}{{sfn|"Cosplay Friday"|2012}}{{sfn|Arcelona|2012}} In June 2014, Turney's notability as a cosplayer allowed her to appear on the [[Syfy]] series ''[[Heroes of Cosplay]]''.{{sfn|"Wizard World Portland"|2014}} Turney was a special guest at the 2016 edition of Fan Expo Vancouver.{{sfn|Gee|2016}} Having worked with various photographers, Turney also has experience modeling.{{sfn|Foster|2015}} In January 2015, ''[[Playboy]]'' ranked Turney at #10 on their "25 Hottest YouTube Stars" listing.{{sfn|Misulonas|2015}} Later in 2015, ''Playboy'' conducted a photoshoot with Turney.{{sfn|"We Photographed"|2015}} In April 2015, ''[[FHM]]'' placed Turney at #20 on their annual "[[FHM's 100 Sexiest Women (UK)|100 Sexiest Women in the World]]" list.{{sfn|"FHM 100 Sexiest"|2015}}{{sfn|Atkin|2015}} ===Gallery=== {{Gallery |title=Meg Turney's cosplay |width=160 | height=200 |align=center |footer=Photos taken at (from left to right): [[WonderCon|WonderCon 2013]], [[RTX (event)#RTX 2014|RTX 2014]], [[Dallas Comic Con|Fan Expo Dallas 2015]], and [[Fan Expo Canada|Fan Expo Canada 2016]]. |File:Meg Turney as Elizabeth from Bioshock.jpg |alt1= |Cosplay of [[Elizabeth (BioShock)|Elizabeth]] from ''[[BioShock Infinite]]''. |File:RTX 2014 - Meg Turney as Vav (14580269724).jpg |alt2= |Cosplay of Vav from ''[[Rooster Teeth#X-Ray and Vav|X-Ray and Vav]]''. |File:Meg Turney Cosplay, Sailor Heavy Metal Papillon.jpg |alt3= |Cosplay of [[Shadow Galactica#Sailor Heavy Metal Papillon|Sailor Heavy Metal Papillon]] from ''[[Sailor Moon]]''. |File:Fan Expo 2016 - Team Rocket (32316761133).jpg |alt4= |Cosplay of a member of [[Team Rocket]] from ''[[Pokémon]]''. }} ==Personal life== Turney has openly spoken about her [[bisexual]]ity with her audience.{{sfn|Turney|2013a}} In a video interview with the YouTube channel ''[[VlogBrothers]]'', she further discussed being bisexual, and spoke about how she was teased for her sexual orientation.{{sfn|Green|2013}} She has been in a relationship with [[Gavin Free]] since 2013. ===Home Invasion=== On January 26, 2018, a fan armed with a handgun broke into Turney's and Free's home, breaking a window to enter and firing one round as he did.{{sfn|Chalk|2018}} Turney and Free hid in a closet and called police. When the man could not find the couple, he left but was confronted by police outside. The suspect fired one shot and police returned fire; when officers approached the suspect's vehicle, they found him dead. Whether the suspect's death was from self-inflicted shots or shots fired by police is under investigation. Turney and Free were unharmed during the incident. It has been assessed the suspect had developed an obsession with Turney, and he was attempting to cause harm to Free, against whom he felt resentment.{{sfn|Kaplan|2018}} Turney ceased updating her YouTube channel for nearly half a year following the incident, citing concern for her safety in sharing her life with an audience.{{cite web |last1=Turney |first1=Meg |title=Why I've Been Gone - Meg Turney |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MLFrmC_Vs3c |website=YouTube |accessdate=28 June 2018}} ==Filmography== ===Web series=== {| class="wikitable sortable" ! Year ! Title ! Role ! class="unsortable"|Notes |- | 2014 | ''Under the Table'' | Herself | |- | 2014 | ''[[Ten Little Roosters]]'' | Herself | Episode: ''And Then There Were Nine'' |- | 2014–2016 | ''[[Rooster Teeth#The Know|The Know]]'' | Herself, co-host | |- | 2014–2016 | ''On the Spot'' | Herself, contestant | |- | 2015 | ''[[X-Ray and Vav]]'' | Woman (voice) | Episode: ''The Dawn of Mogar'' |- |2015 | ''Immersion'' | Meg the Raider | Episode: ''Fallout 4 in Real Life Part 2'' |- | 2015 | ''Buff Buddies'' | Herself | |- | 2015–2016 | ''[[RWBY]]'' | Neon Katt{{sfn|"RWBY Volume 3, Chapter 5"|2015}} | Two episodes |- | 2015–2016 | ''Free Play'' | Herself, co-host | |- | 2016 | ''Crunch Time'' | Ava Fontaine | Two episodes |} ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" ! Year ! Title ! Role ! class="unsortable"|Notes |- | 2015 | ''[[Lazer Team]]'' | Ruby Lakes cheerleader | Uncredited cameo |} ==References== {{reflist|30em}} ===Citations=== {{refbegin|30em}} *{{cite Sexy|date=September 25, 2012|accessdate=October 26, 2012}} *{{cite web|ref={{SfnRef|Atkin|2015}}|last=Atkin|first=Elizabeth|url=http://www.fhm.com/girls/zoella-meg-turney-jenna-marbles-in-2015-100-sexiest|title=Meet the vlogging lady-types and sexy internet celebs who’ve broken into 100 Sexiest|work=FHM|date=April 28, 2015|accessdate=June 14, 2015}} *{{cite Post|date=October 28, 2014|accessdate=January 29, 2015}} *{{cite web|ref={{SfnRef|Billboard Staff|2012a}}|author=Billboard Staff|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/photos/live/474592/amas-on-demand-britney-strips-snoop-sells-brownies|title=AMAs On Demand: Britney Strips, Snoop Sells Brownies|work=Billboard|date=October 17, 2012|accessdate=June 14, 2015}} *{{cite web|ref={{SfnRef|Billboard Staff|2012b}}|author=Billboard Staff|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/474381/amas-on-demand-pinks-2012-halloween-costumes-megan-liz-andy-grammer|title=AMAs On Demand: Pink's 2012, Halloween Costumes, Megan & Liz, Andy Grammer|work=Billboard|date=October 31, 2012|accessdate=January 20, 2013}} *{{cite web|ref={{SfnRef|Brouwer|2014}}|last=Brouwer|first=Bree|url=http://www.tubefilter.com/2014/10/29/twitch-rules-of-conduct-update/|title=Twitch Updates Rules Of Conduct, Asks Users To Cover Up|work=Tubefilter|date=October 29, 2014|accessdate=January 29, 2015}} *{{cite web|ref={{SfnRef|Chalk|2018}}|last=Chalk|first=Andy|url=https://www.pcgamer.com/youtubers-gavin-free-and-meg-turney-survive-break-in-by-armed-deranged-fan/|title=YouTubers Gavin Free and Meg Turney survive break-in by armed, deranged fan|work=[[PC Gamer]]|date=February 12, 2018|accessdate=February 13, 2018}} *{{cite web|ref={{SfnRef|Cohen|2013}}|last=Cohen|first=Joshua|url=http://www.tubefilter.com/2013/05/16/sourcefed-sourcefednerd/|title=SourceFed Launches Spinoff YouTube Channel, SourceFed Nerd|work=Tubefilter|date=May 16, 2013|accessdate=May 27, 2013}} *{{cite web|ref={{SfnRef|Cohen|2014}}|last=Cohen|first=Joshua|url=http://www.tubefilter.com/2014/04/03/elliott-morgan-meg-turney-are-leaving-sourcefed/|title=Elliott Morgan And Meg Turney Are Leaving SourceFed|work=Tubefilter|date=April 3, 2014|accessdate=April 5, 2014}} *{{cite web|ref={{SfnRef|"Cosplay [[File:Mctv barbados.jpg|thumb|Multi-Choice TV]] '''Multi-Choice TV''' ('''MCTV''') is a [[television]] service provider in [[Barbados]]. It is a [[Multichannel Multipoint Distribution Service]] (MMDS) or [[DVB-C]] [[wireless]] [[microwave]]-based broadcast subscription television provider. They offer a variety of packages which can be considered as comparatively priced to similar providers throughout the world.
The service began operating on December 14, 1987, under the name Subscription Television (STV), which had very few channels offered. The main channels were [[CNN]], [[ESPN]], and [[Lifetime Television]], with an occasional option of [[pay per view]] (PPV) being offered for local special events and the occasional international PPV sports broadcast. In 1996 it was upgraded to include a new platform called Multi-Choice TV which was an [[Analog signal|analog]] wireless microwave broadcast offering many more channels (e.g., [[BBC]], [[CBC Television|Canada's CBC]], [[Trinity Broadcasting Network|TBN]]) eventually maxing the [[Bandwidth (signal processing)|bandwidth]] capacity and having to upgrade the service to a [[Digital data|digital]] broadcast system. Multi-Choice TV have not fully converted all of its subscribers yet. The system relies on [[line-of-sight propagation]] so total island wide coverage have proved to be a problem and the provider is looking into alternatives. A recent press release have indicated their interest in a partnership with the local [[Telecommunications company|telco]] [[LIME (Cable & Wireless)|LIME]]. From 1 September 2008 MCTV replaced the Travel Channel on 511 (part of the High Flyer package) by Setanta Sports.
The service uses a [[Yagi antenna]] to receive the encrypted broadcast, which in turn is then decrypted by the provider's set top box. The provider now has the problem of signal theft by pirates using modified DVB-C compatible receivers and PCI cards with the most popular being the "Dreambox" manufactured in [[Germany]] to decode their signal which is based on [[Nagravision]] which is a conditional access control system developed by the [[Kudelski Group]]. In order to prevent such activity in August, 2006 the [[Government of Barbados]] stiffened the local Barbadian copyright laws, in addition to a strengthening of the laws on cable TV piracy. The CBC provider is planning for further circumvention of the Dream boxes in 2009.<ref>{{cite news |title=DREAM OVER |first=Barry |last=Alleyne |authorlink= |url=http://www.nationnews.com/story/dream-over-for-CBC-pirates-copy-for-web |format= |agency= |newspaper=[[The Daily Nation (Barbados)|Nation Newspaper]] |publisher= |location= |isbn= |issn= |oclc= |pmid= |pmd= |bibcode= |doi= |id= |date=28 November 2009 |page= |pages= |accessdate=2 December 2009 |trans-title=|quote="Our investigations also discovered that Dream Box users were able to get a free service since early 2008, because CBC's old encryption software only scrambled their MCTV signal every two minutes, which allowed the Dream Box to recover the signal. But the new security will leave the Dream Boxes crippled. "This is a money business, and encryption is always changing, and not cheap. The new software will actually scramble the MCTV signal every ten to 15 seconds, so Dream Boxes will not be able to keep up, and eventually lose the entire signal," the source added." |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091203215206/http://www.nationnews.com/story/dream-over-for-CBC-pirates-copy-for-web|archivedate=2009-12-03|dead-url=yes |ref= }}</ref>
In 2014 MCTV have gone through a massive upgrade of improving their services by including new channels such as MovieCity Action and Hollywood, AMC, KTLA, WGN, Disney, NBC Sports network, etc. Also MCTV have upgraded their systems to 20 HD channels such as ABC, NBC, CBS & FOX and have also added new PVR boxes. MCTV new slogan is MCTV the Right Choice and are increasing their channel line ups and packaging for their loyal customers in Barbados. MCTV is still the number 1 provider in Barbados but they have competition from Lime Barbados and Flow, but the advantage MCTV has is, it does not depend on the internet to provide single for their customers and when there is rainy and cloudy condition MCTV still provides good service.
Multi-Choice TV also competes against the [[United States|US]]-based [[direct broadcast satellite]] (DBS) service provider [[DirecTV]] in Barbados. The service uses the [[NTSC]] television format.
