{{Infobox animanga/Header | name = Myself ; Yourself | image = [[File:Myself ; Yourself limited edition game cover.jpg|230px]] | caption = ''Myself ; Yourself'' limited edition visual novel cover featuring Nanaka Yatsushiro. | ja_kanji = マイセルフ；ユアセルフ | ja_romaji = Maiserufu ; Yuaserufu | genre = [[Drama]], [[Romance (love)|Romance]] }} {{Infobox animanga/Print | type = light novel | title = Myself ; Yourself Sorezore Overture | author = [[Takumi Nakazawa]] | illustrator = Wadapen | publisher = [[MediaWorks (publisher)|MediaWorks]] | demographic = Male | imprint = | magazine = [[Dengeki G's Magazine]] | first = March 30, 2007 | last = November 30, 2007 | volumes = 6 chapters | volume_list = }} {{Infobox animanga/Video | type = tv series | director = [[Yasuhiro Kuroda]] | producer = | writer = [[Gō Zappa]] | music = 5zizz | studio = [[Doga Kobo]] | licensee = {{English anime licensee|NA=[[Section23 Films#Maiden Japan|Maiden Japan]]}} | network = [[Television Kanagawa|tvk]], [[Chiba Television Broadcasting|CTC]], [[TV Saitama]], [[TV Aichi]], [[TV Osaka|TVO]], [[AT-X (company)|AT-X]] | first = October 3, 2007 | last = December 26, 2007 | episodes = 13 | episode_list = List of Myself ; Yourself episodes#Episode list }} {{Infobox animanga/Game | developer = [[Yeti (Japanese company)|Yeti]] | publisher = [[Regista]] | genre = [[Visual novel]] | platforms = [[PlayStation 2]] | released = December 20, 2007 }} {{Infobox animanga/Game | title = Myself ; Yourself: Sorezore no Finale | developer = [[Yeti (Japanese company)|Yeti]] | publisher = [[Regista]] | genre = [[Visual novel]] | platforms = [[PlayStation 2]] | released = May 28, 2009 }} {{Infobox animanga/Footer}} {{Nihongo|'''''Myself ; Yourself'''''|マイセルフ；ユアセルフ|Maiserufu ; Yuaserufu}}{{ref label|title|a|}} is a [[Japan]]ese [[visual novel]] developed by [[Yeti (Japanese company)|Yeti]] which was released on December 20, 2007 for the [[PlayStation 2]]. ''Myself ; Yourself'' is the second original game published by [[Regista]], the first being ''[[I/O (visual novel)|I/O]]''. [[Takumi Nakazawa]], the main scenario writer for the ''infinity'' series (''[[Ever17]]'', ''[[Remember11]]''), is the principal writer for ''Myself ; Yourself''. Character design for the game is provided by [[Mutsumi Sasaki]], who also produced the original character design for ''[[Memories Off]]'', ''[[Happy Lesson]]'', and ''[[Futakoi]]''. Before the game's release, a [[light novel]] based on the story, written by [[Takumi Nakazawa]], and illustrated by Wadapen, was serialized in the Japanese [[bishōjo]] magazine ''[[Dengeki G's Magazine]]'' between March and November 2007, published by [[MediaWorks (publisher)|MediaWorks]]. An [[anime]] adaptation began airing in Japan on October 3, 2007 on the [[TV Kanagawa]] television network, and contained thirteen episodes. A [[Spin-off (media)|spin-off]] sequel to the visual novel was developed by the previous staff entitled ''Myself ; Yourself: Sorezore no Finale'' and was released on May 28, 2009 for the PlayStation 2.
==Plot== ''Myself ; Yourself'' is set in 2007 in the fictional town {{Nihongo|Sakuranomori|桜乃杜}} in W Prefecture which is modeled after [[Wakayama Prefecture]], [[Japan]]. The town is in a quiet, rural area on the southern tip of the prefecture and borders the [[Pacific Ocean]]. Sakuranomori is the birthplace of Sana Hidaka, a sixteen-year-old high school student, who grew up with his childhood friends Nanaka Yatsushiro & Aoi Oribe, his best friend Shusuke Wakatsuki, and Shusuke's fraternal [[twin]] sister Shuri Wakatsuki. Sana left Sakuranomori when he was eleven years old, but returns five years later living on his own in the apartment building Aoi's family runs. Sana soon finds out that while some things have stayed the same, there are still just as many things that have changed.
==Characters== <!-- Anyone who has played the game, please make distinctions between what was in the game, and what was in the anime. -->
===Protagonists=== ;{{Nihongo|Sana Hidaka|日高 佐菜|Hidaka Sana|born October 13, 1991}} :{{anime voice|[[Shinnosuke Tachibana]]}} (regular), [[Madoka Kimura]] (childhood) :Sana is the main protagonist of the series. He left Sakuranomori during his childhood, and during the beginning of the series he comes back to live by himself in the apartment building owned by Aoi's parents. He apparently had a crush on Nanaka before he left and still holds those feelings for her. He used to play the piano, but he forgot every song except the song Nanaka wrote for him which he says is very important to him. He has a [[Hemophobia|fear of blood]] because he tried to commit suicide during his middle-school years due to constantly being bullied. At the end of the anime series, Sana proposes to Nanaka and she accepts by wearing the proposal ring during her concert.
:In the game, his default romantic partner is Nanaka Yatsushiro, as shown in "Sorezore no Finale".
;{{Nihongo|Shusuke Wakatsuki<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.yetigame.jp/myselfyourself/chara/syusuke/syusuke.gif|title=Image of Syusuke's official romanization|accessdate=2007-09-03|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110722131046/http://www.yetigame.jp/myselfyourself/chara/syusuke/syusuke.gif|archive-date=2011-07-22|dead-url=yes|df=}}</ref>|若月 修輔|Wakatsuki Shūsuke|born March 23, 1991}} :{{anime voice|[[Takehito Koyasu]]}} (regular), [[Yūko Sanpei]] (childhood) :Shūsuke is one of the four childhood friends Sana left behind when he moved, and they renew their friendship on his return. He is Sana's best friend and the only male besides Sana in their circle. He is the younger twin of Shuri Wakatsuki. Yuzuki-sensei refers him as the lucky one of the Wakatsuki twins. When he and Shuri are accused of being lovers, their father decides to send Shuri away to London. When Shuri tells Shūsuke that she cannot stand to be separated from him, they decide to run away together knowing people will think that they have eloped. :In the game, his default romantic partner is Asami Hoshino, as shown in "Sorezore no Finale". However, in the first game, if Sana takes Shuri's route, Shūsuke will admit that he has romantic feelings for his sister. Even though Shūsuke has these feelings, if playing the game as Shūsuke, there is no Shuri route.
===Heroines=== ;{{Nihongo|Nanaka Yatsushiro|八代 菜々香|Yatsushiro Nanaka|born July 29, 1991}} :{{anime voice|[[Ami Koshimizu]]}} :Nanaka is one of Sana's childhood friends and seemed to have feelings for Sana. When Sana returns to town after five years, her personality has changed from sweet and caring to a cold and moody demeanor. On meeting again she slaps him, apparently for not recognizing her. In the anime, it is also explained that they had agreed to send letters to one another and that Sana had neglected to do so, while Nanaka had stuffed their mailbox with countless letters begging for help. This may have also provided motivation for the slap. She still seems to have romantic feelings for him as she gets jealous whenever Sana is with another girl (especially Asami).
:Nanaka was a victim of a possible arson shortly after Sana left Sakuranomori, and lost both of her parents in the fire. She managed to escape with only her violin (which she stopped playing and kept only as a memento) and the sakura bracelet that Sana had given her. She claims [[Post-traumatic amnesia|not to remember]] anything of the events of that night. Her uncle and aunt took her in and made efforts to ensure that she didn't try to remember to spare her further pain. Events after Sana's return, however, start triggering buried memories and she comes to remember everything. Her father was unable to cope with the knowledge that her mother had been unfaithful to him with their very close friend a short time prior to their marriage. As a result, Nanaka's father immolated himself and his wife after knocking her senseless when she confirmed that Nanaka was in fact the result of the tryst and not his daughter after all, something that Nanaka's uncle had always suspected. (Nanaka's biological father was also her violin teacher.) Unable to cope with the burden of her returned memories, Nanaka attempts suicide but is discovered in time by Sana, who overcomes his fear of blood to save her. In the last episode of the anime, Sana proposes to her and she accepts.
:In the game, her default romantic partner is Sana, as shown in "Sorezore no Finale". It is also revealed that she and Asami Hoshino are cousins, which surprises Hinako at first. She later comments that she knew there was some kind of a connection between them because they both had the same air to them. Nanaka dreams of becoming a professional violinist, which was inspired by Sana's suggestion as a child.
;{{Nihongo|Aoi Oribe|織部 麻緒衣|Oribe Aoi|born August 28, 1990}} :{{anime voice|[[Tomoko Kaneda]]}} :Despite the fact that Sana calls her mother his aunt, Aoi and Sana are not related (in Japan it is common to refer to a woman older than oneself as oba-san, which is also the term used for an aunt). Her parents own the apartment building that Sana lives in. Her vision has weakened ever since she entered high school, so she now wears glasses. She loves to read books and is very energetic but clumsy. She has a very high-pitched voice and child-like character, but has a busty physique. Despite being childish, Aoi has a very caring personality, and never fails to aid a friend in need. Her dream is to become a picture-book author. This dream was inspired by Sana.
;{{Nihongo|Shuri Wakatsuki<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.yetigame.jp/myselfyourself/chara/syuri/syuri.gif|title=Image of Syuri's official romanization|accessdate=2007-09-03|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070928132919/http://www.yetigame.jp/myselfyourself/chara/syuri/syuri.gif|archivedate=2007-09-28|df=}}</ref>|若月 朱里|Wakatsuki Shūri|born March 23, 1991}} :{{anime voice|[[Yukari Tamura]]}} :Shuri is one of Sana's childhood friends and the older twin of Shūsuke. Yuzuki-sensei refers her as the unlucky Wakatsuki twin. She is the most athletic of all the girls, although she is somewhat lacking when it comes to her figure. Shuri is a very supportive friend and had no trouble reconnecting with Sana, even after his prolonged absence. She also volunteers at the local retirement home and later invites Asami to join her. In the anime, she and Shūsuke run away together, but come back in the final episode to see Nanaka's violin performance.
[[File:Myself ; Yourself heroines.jpg|thumb|400px|right|The heroines of ''Myself ; Yourself'' (from left to right): Nanaka, Aoi, Shuri, Hinako, Yuzuki, and Asami.]] ;{{Nihongo|Hinako Mochida|持田 雛子|Mochida Hinako|born August 5, 1997}} :{{anime voice|[[Ayumi Murata]]}}, [[Ayano Niina]] (''Sorezore no Finale'') :Hinako is a ten-year-old girl going on eleven. She has been infatuated with Shūsuke since he saved her from three bullies who had taken her school bag and would not give it back. She wants to know how to become a girl that he will like and asks Sana and Aoi for their help. Hinako's personality is similar to Aoi's, however being only in the fifth grade, she is more childish. In the last anime episode, it is shown that she is the girlfriend of Asami's cousin, who is five years younger than she is.
;{{Nihongo|Yuzuki Fujimura|藤村 柚希|Fujimura Yuzuki|born December 26, 1982}} :{{anime voice|[[Megumi Toyoguchi]]}} :Yuzuki is the twenty-five-year-old homeroom teacher of Sana's class; Shūsuke, Nanaka, and Shuri are also in the same class. It is a well known secret that she rewards her students with caramel candy whenever they do a good job in school, whether it involves assigned duties or favors for her. This habit of rewarding her students with candy originated many years previously when she was still in high school and found a child attempting to perform a flip over a metal bar in the park (revealed to be Sana in the anime). She offered him a caramel as a reward if he succeeded, which, of course, he did.
;{{Nihongo|Asami Hoshino|星野 あさみ|Hoshino Asami|born October 28, 1991}} :{{anime voice|[[Mai Nakahara]]}} :Asami is Sana's childhood friend and a second year student. Although she volunteers at the retirement home along with Shuri and seems to have a very gentle personality, she is in fact quite vindictive and takes revenge on people who hurt her. In the anime, she had a crush on Shuri and when she confessed to her, Shuri said that they should remain friends. Angered, Asami wrote a letter to the school accusing Shuri and her twin of being lovers. She later invites Shuri and Sana to the hospital to visit a sick woman from the retirement home in an attempt to hurt Shuri mentally. To her surprise, Shuri doesn't react as she expected and seems unfazed. The old woman obtains a knife and tries to kill Shuri in a fit of madness (brought on by the death of her granddaughter) but Asami knocks Shuri out of harm's way and is stabbed in her stead. She comes to realize that her hatred of Shuri is unfounded and tries to make amends. :In the game, her default romantic partner is Shūsuke Wakatsuki, as shown in "Sorezore no Finale". She is also revealed to be Nanaka's cousin.
==Media==
===Light novel=== A six-chapter [[light novel]] under the title {{Nihongo|''Myself ; Yourself Sorezore Overture''|Myself ; Yourself それぞれのOverture}}, based on the visual novel's story, started serialization in the Japanese [[bishōjo]] magazine ''[[Dengeki G's Magazine]]'' on March 30, 2007 and ran until November 30, 2007.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.yetigame.jp/myselfyourself/overture/overture_index.htm|title=Myself ; Yourself Overture official website|publisher=Yeti|accessdate=2007-10-26|language=Japanese|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071011050443/http://www.yetigame.jp/myselfyourself/overture/overture_index.htm|archivedate=2007-10-11|df=}}</ref> The novel is written as a prologue to the game by [[Takumi Nakazawa]], who has also written scenarios for ''[[Ever17]]'', and ''[[Memories Off|Memories Off 2nd]]'', and is illustrated by Wadapen. Each chapter centers on one of the six heroines; chapters one through six are arranged as: Nanaka, Aoi, Shuri, Yuzuki, Hinako, and Asami.
;Chapters #{{Nihongo|"Seven children: Nanaka's Story"|七つの子|Nanatsu no Ko}}, published March 30, 2007 #{{Nihongo|"The Lost Child Aoi-san: Aoi's Story"|まいごのあおいさん|Maigo no Aoi-san}}, published April 30, 2007 #{{Nihongo|"Me and Him, My Friend: Shuri's Story"|私とあいつと、私の仲間|Watashi to Aitsu to, Watashi no Nakama}}, published June 30, 2007 #"Close Encounter: Yuzuki's Story", published August 30, 2007 #{{Nihongo|"A Small and Large First Step: Hinako's Story"|小さくて、大きな第一歩|Chiisakute, Ōkina Daiippo}}, published September 30, 2007 #{{Nihongo|"What Thing Did You Lose?: Asami's Story"|なくした もの は、なんですか?|Nakushita Mono wa, Nan desu ka?}}, published November 30, 2007
===Anime=== {{see also|List of Myself ; Yourself episodes}} An [[anime]] adaptation aired in Japan between October 3, 2007 and December 26, 2007 on the [[TV Kanagawa]] [[television network]] containing thirteen episodes. The series is directed by [[Yasuhiro Kuroda]], and produced by the animation studio [[Dogakobo]] through the ''Myself ; Yourself'' Production Committee, which is composed of Happinet Pictures, [[Marvelous Entertainment]], The 5pb, and [[Pony Canyon]] Enterprises. Seven DVD compilations, the first six containing two episodes of the anime, and the last containing the final episode have been released; the DVDs are distributed by Happinet Pictures. The anime has been licensed by [[Section23 Films#Maiden Japan|Maiden Japan]].
===Visual novels=== The ''Myself ; Yourself'' [[visual novel]], developed by Yeti, was released on December 20, 2007 playable on the [[PlayStation 2]]. The game is published by [[Regista]] which mainly [[Porting|ports]] all-age versions of [[Eroge|adult games]] developed by other companies, but in 2006 developed and published their first original game called ''[[I/O (visual novel)|I/O]]''; ''Myself ; Yourself'' is the second time Regista has published an original title. Character design for the game is provided by [[Mutsumi Sasaki]], who also did the original character design for ''[[Memories Off]]'', ''[[Chaos;Head]]'', ''[[Happy Lesson]]'', and ''[[Futakoi]]''. Unlike most visual novels, ''Myself ; Yourself'' has two male protagonists.
A [[Spin-off (media)|spin-off]] sequel to the visual novel entitled {{Nihongo|''Myself ; Yourself: Sorezore no Finale''|Myself ; Yourself それぞれのfinale}} was developed by the previous production staff and was released in spring 2009.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://dps.dengeki.com/2008/11/post_679.html|title=''Myself ; Yourself: Sorezore no Finale'' announcement|publisher=[[ASCII Media Works]]|date=2008-11-27|accessdate=2008-11-27|language=Japanese|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090225220253/http://dps.dengeki.com/2008/11/post_679.html|archivedate=2009-02-25|df=}}</ref> The game features four new scenarios with Nanaka and Asami getting separate scenarios, and there are two duel scenarios with Shuri and Aoi in one, and Hinako and Yuzuki in the other. Several new characters are also introduced.
==Music== The opening theme for the anime is "Tears Infection" by [[Kaori (voice actress)|Kaori]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2007-07-24/myself-yourself-anime-airs-in-october-with-kaori-song|title=''Myself;Yourself'' Anime Airs in October with KAORI Song|date=July 24, 2007|publisher=[[Anime News Network]]|accessdate=January 24, 2010}}</ref> and the ending theme is {{Nihongo|"Kimi to Yozora to Sakamichi to"|キミと夜空と坂道と}} by [[Kanako Itō]]; the singles for both songs were released on October 24, 2007. The first opening theme for the visual novel is "Day-break" by Kaori, and the second opening theme is "ivy" by Kanako Itō. "Day-break" was released on the same single album as "Tears Infection", and "ivy" was released on the same single as "Kimi to Yozora to Sakamichi to" as [[A-side and B-side|B-side]] tracks. The visual novel version has seven ending themes: "Another World" and "Myself ; Yourself" by [[Ami Koshimizu]], {{Nihongo|"Aoitori"|青い鳥}} by [[Tomoko Kaneda]], "Never leave me alone" by [[Yukari Tamura]], {{Nihongo|"Hajimete no Kiss? (#^.^#)"|はじめてのKiss?(#^.^#)}} by [[Ayumi Murata]], {{Nihongo|"Mirai Kansoku"|未来観測}} by [[Megumi Toyoguchi]], and {{Nihongo|"Haru no Kiss"|春のKISS}} by [[Mai Nakahara]]. Each of the ending themes are sung by the [[Seiyū|voice actresses]] of the six heroines from the series. These songs were released as [[Image song|character song]] albums: volumes one through three were released on November 21, 2007 and consist of the themes "Another World", "Hajimete no Kiss? (#^.^#)", and "Haru no Kiss" respectively. The second batch, volumes four through six, were released on December 7, 2007 and consisted of the themes "Never leave me home", "Aoitori", and "Mirai Kansoku" respectively. The game's original soundtrack was released with the limited edition release of the game on December 20, 2007; the soundtrack was also used for the anime version.
==Reception== Stig Høgset from THEM Anime Reviews comments that the anime is similar to ''[[Kanon (visual novel)|Kanon]]'' due to both having "a guy who's not a complete loser, who returns to his old town and meets various people, most of them girls or teachers/parents of said girls. Unlike with ''Kanon'', however, these are people he already know{{sic}}." He criticizes the anime for Aoi's "unchanging voice" throughout the flashback, the present and the epilogue that flash forwards ten years into the future.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.themanime.org/viewreview.php?id=1035|title=Myself; Yourself|first=Stig|last=Høgset|publisher=THEM Anime Reviews|accessdate=January 24, 2010}}</ref>

A. Shrikumar Menon]] | producer = [[Antony Perumbavoor]] | screenplay = Harikrishnan | starring = {{plainlist| * [[Mohanlal]] * [[Prakash Raj]] * [[Manju Warrier]] }} | music = {{plainlist| * [[M. Jayachandran]] * [[Sam C. S.]] }} | editing = [[Johnkutty]] | cinematography = [[Shaji Kumar]] | studio = [[Aashirvad Cinemas]] | distributor = [[Maxlab Cinemas and Entertainments|Max Creations Release]] | released = {{Film date|df=yes|2018|12|14}} | runtime = | country = India | language = [[Malayalam]] | budget = <!--Must be attributed to a reliable published source with an established reputation for fact-checking. No blogs, no IMDb.--> | gross = <!--Must be attributed to a reliable published source with an established reputation for fact-checking. No blogs, no IMDb.--> }}
'''''Odiyan''''' is an upcoming Indian [[Malayalam]]-language <!--DO NOT add or change genre without providing a reliable source-->[[Fantasy film|fantasy]] [[Thriller film|thriller]] film directed by [[V. A. Shrikumar Menon]] in his [[feature film]] debut. It was written by Harikrishnan and is based on the legend of the Odiyan clan, who in [[Kerala]] [[folklore]] are men possessing [[shapeshifting]] abilities, who could assume animal form. Odiyans are said to have inhabited the [[Malabar region]] of Kerala during the era before electricity. The film stars [[Mohanlal]] in the title role, alongside [[Prakash Raj]] and [[Manju Warrier]]. The film was produced by [[Antony Perumbavoor]] through [[Aashirvad Cinemas]].
[[Principal photography]] began in [[Varanasi]], [[Uttar Pradesh]] in August 2017. Major parts of the film were shot in [[Palakkad district]], where the Thenkurissi village in the film was recreated. Some scenes were also filmed in [[Vagamon]], [[Athirappilly]], and [[Kochi]]. The film was completed after 145 days of shooting. [[Sam C. S.]] composed the film's score and it also features songs composed by [[M. Jayachandran]]. ''Odiyan'' is set to release worldwide on 14 December 2018.
==Cast== * [[Mohanlal]] as Odiyan Manikyan * [[Prakash Raj]] as Ravunni * [[Manju Warrier]] as Prabha * [[Innocent (actor)|Innocent]] as Gopi Mash * [[Siddique (actor)|Siddique]] as Damodharan Nair * [[Manoj Joshi (actor)|Manoj Joshi]] as Muthappan * [[Nandhu]] as Ezhuthachan * [[Narain (actor)|Narain]] as Prakashan * [[Kailash (actor)|Kailash]] as Ravi * [[Sana Althaf]] as Meenakshi * [[Santhosh Keezhattoor]] as Vasudevan * Sreejaya Nair
==Production== ===Development=== On 4 February 2017, ''[[Kerala Kaumudi]]'' reported that a [[3D film]] titled ''Odiyan'' was in development, starring [[Mohanlal]] and [[Amitabh Bachchan]], written by Harikrishnan and to be directed by [[commercial director]] [[V. A. Shrikumar Menon]] in what will be his [[feature film]] debut. Bachchan was reported to be playing the father role of Mohanlal's character, with Prakash Raj and Manju Warrier in substantial roles. It said the film is based on the legends of the "Odiyan" clan—mythical [[Black magic|black magicians]] with the ability to [[Shapeshifting|shapeshift]] by using a trick called ''odi vidya''.<ref>{{cite news|last=രാജേഷ്|first=വി. എസ്.|title=മോഹൻലാലിന്റെ ഒടിയൻ ത്രീഡിയിൽ ബച്ചനും|url=https://s31.postimg.cc/xq6cjw31n/Kerala_Kaumudi_epaper_page_no.14_-_04-02-2017.png|accessdate=14 May 2018|work=[[Kerala Kaumudi]]|date=4 February 2017|archiveurl=https://archive.is/Z7YyA|archivedate=14 May 2018|language=ml|deadurl=no}}</ref> Inhabiting mostly the [[Malabar region]]s (North Kerala), the legend is that Odiyans used to terrorise people to death by appearing in animal forms at night, called ''odi veykkuka''. In Harikrishnan's account, this account was fact: this was their vocation, but in modern times the Odiyans were wiped out from history and faded into oblivion. This story was completely based on the tales of Odiyan and he did not make any additional research.<ref name="MM">{{cite news|last=K.|first=Padmakumar|title=Mohanlal's 'Odiyan', as perceived by its creator Harikrishnan|url=https://english.manoramaonline.com/entertainment/interview/2018/05/27/mohanlal-odiyan-as-perceived-by-its-creator-harikrishnan.html|accessdate=20 November 2018|work=[[Malayala Manorama]]|date=27 May 2018}}</ref>
On 26 March 2017, the project was officially confirmed by Mohanlal via [[Social networking service|social media]]. He wrote that [[Antony Perumbavoor]] would produce the film through [[Aashirvad Cinemas]] and [[Sabu Cyril]] (replaced by Prashanth Madhav) and [[Shaji Kumar]] would serve as production designer and cinematographer, while Warrier would play the female lead role—though he did not mention Bachchan, Raj or the 3D format.<ref>{{cite news|author=Express Web Desk|title=Mohanlal says his next film Odiyan will be a visual treat|url=http://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/malayalam/mohanlal-says-his-next-film-odiyan-will-be-a-visual-treat-4586166/|accessdate=28 August 2017|work=[[The Indian Express]]|date=26 March 2017}}</ref> Menon said ''Odiyan'' is a "rustic thriller" and the story is rooted on the tribes of Odiyans and their myth. Odiyans can be described as the first "quotation gangs" (hired criminals) in [[Kerala]], who went in disguise of animals during night hours to attack enemies.<ref name="TNIE1">{{cite news|last=Suresh|first=Meera|title='Odiyan will be a landmark in Mohanlal's illustrious career'|url=http://www.newindianexpress.com/entertainment/malayalam/2017/mar/26/odiyan--will-be-a-landmark-in-mohanlals-illustrious-career-1586231.html|accessdate=29 July 2018|work=[[The New Indian Express]]|date=26 March 2017}}</ref> The film is a [[magical realism]] thriller.<ref>{{cite news|last=U. R.|first=Arya|title=Odiyan is set between 50s and 90s: V A Shrikumar Menon|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/malayalam/movies/news/odiyan-is-set-between-50s-and-90s-v-a-shrikumar-menon/articleshow/58297402.cms|accessdate=11 October 2017|work=[[The Times of India]]|date=21 April 2017}}</ref> Both Menon and Harikrishnan hail from Palakkad (Malabar) and grown up hearing the legends of Odiyans during their childhood. It was Harikrishsnan's long-time dream to write a story on Odiyans. The film is also set in rural Palakkad.<ref>{{cite news|last=Sreekumar|first=Priya|title=Odiyan tales retold|url=https://www.deccanchronicle.com/entertainment/mollywood/060417/odiyan-tales-retold.html|accessdate=24 November 2018|work=[[Deccan Chronicle]]|date=6 April 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=ഒടിയന്റെ പിറവിക്കു പിന്നില്‍, ശ്രീകുമാര്‍ മേനോന്‍ പറയുന്നത്|url=https://southlive.in/movie/celebrity-talk/odiyan-movie-behind-story/|publisher=Southlive.in|accessdate=24 November 2018|language=ml|date=7 April 2018}}</ref>
Menon and Harikrishnan initially planned a children's film titled ''Randu Vaanavillukal''. The film was set in the backdrop of the [[drylands]] of [[Tamil Nadu]]. Before filming, however, the [[2015 South Indian floods|Tamil Nadu flood]] happened, turning the filming land green and lush after the flood. The terrain was unsuitable for the film and their plans to shift the location also went futile. The two met again for a follow-up discussion.<ref name="NFW1">{{cite web|last=Suresh|first=K.|title=ഒരിടത്തൊരിടത്തൊരു ഒടിയനുണ്ടായിരുന്നു......|url=https://www.magzter.com/IN/NANA-FILM-WEEKLY/Nana-Film/Entertainment/273169|website=[[Magzter]]|publisher=Nana Film Weekly|accessdate=15 November 2018|pages=8 – 11|language=ml|date=15 April 2018|subscription=yes}}</ref> ''Odiyan'' originated from the conversation between Menon and Harikrishnan. Menon liked a one-line story of it narrated by Harikrishnan. Afterwards, Harikrishnan wrote a single scene of ''Odiyan'', intended as the introduction of the title character. He showed it to Menon, who in turn sent it to Mohanlal and the project took off. The scene remains in the film's final cut too. Earlier, writer-director [[A. K. Lohithadas]] had also proceeded with a story based on an Odiyan with Mohanlal himself in the lead role, but it was not made into a film. Later, director [[Lal Jose]] also contemplated on making such a film, but later dropped the idea. Evaluating these unsuccessful attempts, Harikrishnan said that it could be because they might have directly followed the myth behind Odiyans, rather than making a novel adaptation. Harikrishnan wrote ''Odiyan'' devoid of myth.<ref name="deepika">{{cite news|url=https://www.deepika.com/cinema/StarChat.aspx?Script-Writer-Harikrishnan-about-Odiyan-and-Mohanlal&ID=605|title="ഒടിയൻ' മാസ് – ഫാന്റസി ത്രില്ലർ: തിരക്കഥാകൃത്ത് ഹരികൃഷ്ണൻ|last=ബൈജുനാഥ്|first=ടി. ജി.|date=9 July 2018|work=[[Deepika (newspaper)|Deepika]]|accessdate=19 November 2018|language=ml}}</ref> Antony Perumbavoor suggested a major change in the first draft of screenplay which introduced a villain in the film. The script was completely rehashed based on that, after which Menon described Antony as an ace [[script doctor]]. Mohanlal suggested two minor changes in the second draft and approved the screenplay in the second sitting.<ref name="NFW1" />
Harikrishnan received the hinge of the story back when he was lecturing journalism classes when he asked the students to write a [[feature story]] to test their creativity. The subject was: "if Hollywood director Steven Spielberg comes to [[Palakkad]] to meet the last Odiyan". The word "last" was registered in his mind and became the [[Plot device|plot point]] in his screenplay. His story is about the last surviving Odiyan and why the clan became extinct after him. The story spans 50 years through three generations of the last Odiyan lineage and is set in the [[Thenkurissi (gram panchayat)|Thenkurissi]] village in Palakkad, where Odiyans were most popular. It is a concoction of folktales prevalent in the [[Malabar region]], chiefly in Palakkad. The screenplay was registered in the [[Writers Guild of America]]. Producer Antony Perumbavoor gave them freedom to conceive the film as big as possible, giving the film an open budget.<ref name="MM"/>
===Pre-production=== The initial plan was to shoot the film in 3D but the plan was later dropped.<ref name="deepika"/> In March 2017, it was reported that [[A. Sreekar Prasad]] would be the film's editor (he was later replaced by [[Johnkutty]]), [[M. Jayachandran]] as music director, [[P. M. Satheesh]] as sound designer, [[Peter Hein]] as stunt coordinator and Gokuldas (replaced by Prashanth Madhav) as art director. Menon said ''Odiyan'' is likely to release in 2017 itself, but is uncertain as the film requires an extensive post-production with a large chunk of time need to be spend for [[visual effects]]. Filming was then scheduled to begin on 25 May 2017.<ref name="TNIE1"/> In June 2017, the film crew convened for a script discussion session at an outdoor location in Kava, [[Palakkad]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Shrikumar|first=V. A.|title=Odiyan script discussion at Kava|url=https://www.facebook.com/vashrikumar/posts/1367559563351770|website=[[Facebook]]|publisher=V A Shrikumar|accessdate=18 November 2018|date=20 June 2017}}</ref> The film was then scheduled to begin on 1 August.<ref>{{cite news|title=Odiyan goes on the floors on August 1|url=http://www.newindianexpress.com/entertainment/malayalam/2017/jun/14/odiyan-goes-on-the-floors-on-august-1-1616706.html|accessdate=22 November 2018|work=[[The New Indian Express]]|agency=Express News Service|date=14 June 2017}}</ref>
The official [[Puja (Hinduism)|puja]] function of the film was held at hotel [[Vivanta by Taj]] in [[Thiruvananthapuram]] on 5 July 2017. The venue was shared by Aashirvad Cinemas' ''[[Aadhi]]''{{'s}} puja as well.<ref>{{cite news|author=TNM staff|title=Pranav Mohanlal's debut as hero is finally happening, watch out for 'Aadhi'|url=https://www.thenewsminute.com/article/pranav-mohanlals-debut-hero-finally-happening-watch-out-aadhi-64707|accessdate=22 November 2018|work=[[The News Minute]]|date=5 July 2017}}</ref> In July, Menon said filming would begin by mid-August, "we will be shooting in locations such as Thasarak, [[Kollengode, Palakkad|Kollengode]], [[Alathur]], [[Nemmara]], and [[Pollachi]], where it is believed that Odiyans lived", additionally it will also have [[Varanasi]] as a location.<ref name="TOI1">{{cite news|last=Sidhardhan|first=Sanjith|title=Mohanlal to play a sexagenarian too in Odiyan|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/malayalam/movies/news/mohanlal-to-play-a-sexagenarian-too-in-odiyan/articleshow/59425450.cms|accessdate=19 November 2018|work=[[The Times of India]]|date=4 July 2017}}</ref> He said many [[special effect]]s would be utilised in the film and the post-production would last close to six months.<ref>{{cite news|last=Sidhardhan|first=Sanjith|title=Mohanlal's Odiyan will have five action-packed scenes|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/malayalam/movies/news/mohanlals-odiyan-will-have-five-action-packed-scenes/articleshow/59434957.cms|accessdate=22 November 2018|work=[[The Times of India]]|date=4 July 2017}}</ref> It was also revealed the plan is to simultaneously release the film in Tamil and Telugu languages along with the original Malayalam version.<ref>{{cite news|last=Suresh|first=Meera|title=Mohanlal's Odiyan isn't a horror movie, but a mass entertainer, says director Shrikumar Menon|url=http://www.newindianexpress.com/entertainment/malayalam/2017/nov/28/mohanlals-odiyan-isnt-a-horror-movie-but-a-mass-entertainer-says-director-shrikumar-menon-1712550.html|accessdate=22 November 2018|work=[[The New Indian Express]]|date=28 November 2017}}</ref>
In August, Prashanth Madhav began the film's set work in Palakkad by creating the Thenkurissi village which pass through three eras in the story. The crew went for location [[Recce (filmmaking)|recce]] in Palakkad and Varanasi in the month.<ref>{{cite news|author=Web desk|title=മോഹൻലാലിന്റെ ഒടിയൻ ഒരുങ്ങുന്നു; പ്രീ പ്രൊഡക്ഷൻ വിശേഷങ്ങൾ|url=https://malayalam.indianexpress.com/entertainment/mohanlal-odiyan-getting-ready-for-varanasi-palakkad-shooting-schedule/|accessdate=18 November 2018|work=[[Indian Express Malayalam]]|date=16 August 2017|language=ml}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Mohanlal's Odiyan start rolling at Banaras, Kasi|url=https://english.mathrubhumi.com/movies-music/movie-news/mohanlal-s-odiyan-start-rolling-at-banaras-kasi-mollywood-manju-warrier-movie-shrikumar-menon-1.2198253|accessdate=22 November 2018|work=[[Mathrubhumi]]|date=28 August 2017}}</ref> Menon said that Odiyan Manikyan's journey starts from the holy [[Ghats in Varanasi]], where he spend 15 years before returning to Thenkurissi.<ref>{{cite web|last=Menon|first=Shrikumar|title=Odiyan manickan's journey starts here...|url=https://twitter.com/VA_Shrikumar/status/897638225325555713|website=[[Twitter]]|publisher=Shrikumar Menon|accessdate=22 November 2018|date=15 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Prakash|first=Asha|title=Odiyan team heads to Banaras|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/malayalam/movies/news/odiyan-team-heads-to-banaras/articleshow/60210004.cms|accessdate=18 November 2018|work=[[The Times of India]]|date=24 August 2017}}</ref> For the climax fight sequence set inside an [[Indian banyan]] tree, the team traveled across India to find a suitable tree, in places such as [[Cumbum, Tamil Nadu|Cumbum]], [[Theni]], [[Mysore]] and almost finalised a tree called [[Dodda Alada Mara]] in [[Bangalore Urban]]. However, he was unable to obtain permission for night shooting there. The team finally able to find a tree in Kerala itself, in Palakkad.<ref name=NFW2>{{cite web|last=K.|first=Suresh|title=പാലക്കാടൻ മണ്ണിൽ ഒടിയൻ വിപ്ലവങ്ങൾ|url=https://www.magzter.com/IN/NANA-FILM-WEEKLY/Nana-Film/Entertainment/251023 |website=[[Magzter]]|publisher=Nana Film Weekly|accessdate=15 November 2018|pages=3 – 7|language=ml|date=19 November 2017|subscription=yes}}</ref>
====Casting==== Both Harikrishnan and Menon wanted Mohanlal in the lead role from the film's initial discussion itself and the screenplay was later tailor-made with Mohanlal in mind.<ref name=deepika/><ref name="mangalam">{{cite news|last=പവിത്രൻ|first=ഷെറിങ്|title=അക്ഷരനക്ഷത്രം കോര്‍ത്ത ദൃശ്യതാളങ്ങള്‍ |url=http://www.mangalam.com/news/detail/3/137330-personality.html|accessdate=23 November 2018|work=[[Mangalam Publications]]|date=16 August 2017|language=ml}}</ref> His character Odiyan Manikyan has two stages, one at present and the other 30 years ago.<ref>{{cite news|author=Onmanorama staff|title=Ready to starve to become Odiyan: Mohanlal|url=https://english.manoramaonline.com/entertainment/entertainment-news/2017/09/07/mohanlal-on-odiyan-movie-character.html |accessdate=19 November 2018|work=[[Malayala Manorama]]|date=7 September 2017}}</ref> Describing him, Menon said: "Manikyan is considered the greatest Odiyan that ever lived. He has mastered the skills that have been passed down by his forefathers of the clan".<ref name="TOI1"/> Soon after the film's confirmation by Mohanlal in March 2017, Menon revealed to media outlets that Raj would be portraying the antagonist and Warrier will have an equally important role as that of Mohanlal, while a leading [[Bollywood]] actor would also play a pivotal role.<ref name="TNIE1"/><ref>{{cite news|last=Soman|first=Deepa|title=Iruvar duo Mohanlal and Prakash Raj to team up for Odiyan|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/malayalam/movies/news/iruvar-duo-mohanlal-and-prakash-raj-to-team-up-for-odiyan/articleshow/57855718.cms|accessdate=19 November 2018|work=[[The Times of India]]|date=28 March 2017}}</ref> Raj plays the character of Ravunni.<ref>{{cite news|last=Sidhardhan|first=Sanjith|title=Prakash Raj: Those in power need to have a dialogue with the people. You cannot stifle any movement by force|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/malayalam/movies/news/prakash-raj-those-in-power-need-to-have-a-dialogue-with-the-people-you-cannot-stifle-any-movement-by-force/articleshow/63354195.cms|accessdate=19 November 2018|work=[[The Times of India]] |date=20 March 2017}}</ref> The characters of Mohanlal, Warrier and Raj pass through three stages of their life.<ref>{{cite news|title=Most expensive Malayalam film 'Odiyan' to tell untold story|url=http://www.newindianexpress.com/entertainment/malayalam/2017/mar/29/most-expensive-malayalam-film-odiyan-to-tell-untold-story-1587365.html|accessdate=19 November 2018|work=[[The New Indian Express]]|agency=[[Press Trust of India]]|date=29 March 2017}}</ref> Warrier portrays the character of Prabha.<ref>{{cite news|last=Shrijith|first=Sajin|title=Manju Warrier reveals details of her character Prabha in upcoming Odiyan|url=http://www.newindianexpress.com/entertainment/malayalam/2018/apr/19/manju-warrier-reveals-details-of-her-character-prabha-in-upcoming-odiyan-1803809.html|accessdate=17 November 2018|work=[[The New Indian Express]]|date=19 April 2018}}</ref> In the film, Prabha is shown in her late 20s, at 35 and in her 50s and so will have three looks.<ref>{{cite news|last=Sidhardhan|first=Sanjith|title=Manju Warrier to flaunt three looks in Odiyan|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/malayalam/movies/news/manju-warrier-to-flaunt-three-looks-in-odiyan/articleshow/62473783.cms|accessdate=17 November 2018|work=[[The Times of India]]|date=13 January 2018}}</ref>
In April, Menon confirmed [[Siddique (actor)|Siddique]] and [[Nandhu]] in the cast.<ref>{{cite news|last=Prakash|first=Asha|title=Mohanlal's next will document the little-known history of Kerala’s notorious Odiyan tribe |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/malayalam/movies/news/mohanlals-next-will-document-the-little-known-history-of-keralas-notorious-odiyan-tribe/articleshow/58297826.cms|accessdate=19 November 2018|work=[[The Times of India]]|date=22 April 2017}}</ref> In the same month, it was reported [[Appani Sarath]] would be part of the cast.<ref>{{cite news|last=Mohandas|first=Vandana|title=He loves the stage|url=https://www.deccanchronicle.com/entertainment/mollywood/020817/he-loves-the-stage.html|accessdate=17 November 2018|work=[[Deccan Chronicle]]|date=2 August 2017}}</ref> Negotiations were going on with [[Hindi]] actor [[Amitabh Bachchan]] for a role.<ref>{{cite news|author=IndiaToday.in|title=Odiyan: Mohanlal, Amitabh Bachchan to team up for Sreekumar's next|url=https://www.indiatoday.in/movies/celebrities/story/odiyan-mohanlal-amitabh-bachchan-randamoozham-film-959043-2017-02-05 |accessdate=19 November 2018|work=[[India Today]]|date=5 February 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|author=Web desk|title=അമിതാബ് ബച്ചൻ മോഹൻലാലിന്റെ അച്ഛനായി അഭിനയിക്കുമോ? മലയാളത്തിലെ ചെലവേറിയ ചിത്രം ഒടിയൻ വരുന്നു|url=https://malayalam.indianexpress.com/entertainment/mohanlals-new-project-announced-named-odiyan-with-manju-warrier/|accessdate=19 November 2018|work=[[Indian Express Malayalam]]|date=25 March 2017}}</ref> However, close to filming it was reported [[Tamils|Tamil]] actor [[Sathyaraj]] had replaced Bachchan.<ref>{{cite news|title=ഒടിയനിൽ അമിതാഭ് ബച്ചനില്ല; പകരം സത്യരാജ്|url=http://news.keralakaumudi.com/beta/news.php?NewsId=TkNSUDAxNzA1OTM=&xP=Q1lC&xDT=MjAxNy0wOC0wNSAxMDowNTowMA==&xD=MQ==&cID=OQ==|accessdate=19 November 2018|work=[[Kerala Kaumudi]]|date=5 August 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170808005039/http://news.keralakaumudi.com/beta/news.php?NewsId=TkNSUDAxNzA1OTM=&xP=Q1lC&xDT=MjAxNy0wOC0wNSAxMDowNTowMA==&xD=MQ==&cID=OQ==|archivedate=8 August 2017|language=ml}}</ref> It was for the role of Manikyan's grandfather, for which Hindi actor [[Manoj Joshi]] was ultimately cast. Writer Harikrishnan said, Bachchan had indeed agreed to work in the film, but was unable to join due to personal reasons. Since the film would have been delayed if they waited for Bachchan, they move on to other actors.<ref name="deepika"/> In June, a casting call was released seeking children and teenagers for playing the younger versions of Mohanlal, Warrier and Raj. It also invited youngsters for other undisclosed roles.<ref>{{cite news|author=TNM staff|title=Manju Warrier-Mohanlal film 'Odiyan' is looking for actors|url=https://www.thenewsminute.com/article/manju-warrier-mohanlal-film-odiyan-looking-actors-63923|accessdate=19 November 2018|work=[[The News Minute]]|date=20 June 2017}}</ref>
In September, [[Aneesh G. Menon]] confirmed he is part of the cast.<ref>{{cite news|last=Manu|first=Meera|title=Being the usual and unusual actor: Aneesh G Menon|url=https://www.deccanchronicle.com/entertainment/mollywood/190917/being-the-usual-and-unusual-actor-aneesh-g-menon.html |accessdate=17 November 2018|work=[[Deccan Chronicle]]|date=19 September 2017}}</ref> In November, [[Narain (actor)|Narain]] confirmed he is part of the cast and would join the film in its final schedule, which will shoot Odiyan Manikyan's younger age.<ref>{{cite news|last=Sidhardhan|first=Sanjith|title=Narain joins Mohanlal's Odiyan|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/malayalam/movies/news/narain-joins-mohanlals-odiyan/articleshow/61831234.cms|accessdate=19 November 2018|work=[[The Times of India]]|date=28 November 2017}}</ref> He plays the husband of Prabha and his scenes are with Mohanlal, Raj and Warrier.<ref>{{cite news|last=Sidhardhan|first=Sanjith|title=Narain to play Manju Warrier's husband in Odiyan|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/malayalam/movies/news/narain-to-play-manju-warriers-husband-in-odiyan/articleshow/63442304.cms|accessdate=19 November 2018|work=[[The Times of India]]|date=24 March 2018}}</ref> From the teaser trailer released in December, more of the cast was revealed confirming [[Kailash (actor)|Kailash]], [[Sana Althaf]], and Sreejaya Nair.<ref>{{cite news|last=George|first1=Anjana|title=Mohanlal's Odiyan will have Kailash, Sana Althaf and Sreejaya|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/malayalam/movies/news/mohanlals-odiyan-will-have-kailash-sana-althaf-and-sreejaya/articleshow/62048930.cms|accessdate=19 November 2018|work=[[The Times of India]]|date=13 December 2017}}</ref> Sana plays Warrier's sister and Kailash's wife in the film. She said it was a difficult role to portray. The character has less screen time but is important in the script. Her character has transition from a young girl to an aged woman. Including Sana, many of the artists were prepared through a week long [[acting workshop]]. [[Atul Mongia]] served as the acting workshop director.<ref>{{cite news|last=S.|first=Gautham|title=All hopeful|url=https://deccanchronicle.com/entertainment/mollywood/161018/all-hopeful.html|accessdate=17 November 2018|work=[[Deccan Chronicle]]|date=16 October 2018}}</ref>
===Filming=== [[File:Varanasi Munshi Ghat3.jpg|thumb|Manikyan was in [[Varanasi]] for 15 years]] [[Principal photography]] began on 25 August 2017 in [[Varanasi]], [[Uttar Pradesh]].<ref>{{cite news|author=HT correspondent|title=Odiyan: Mohanlal shoots in Varanasi, tells us more about his character Manikyan. Watch video|url=https://www.hindustantimes.com/regional-movies/odiyan-mohanlal-shoots-in-varanasi-tells-us-more-about-his-character-manikyan-watch-video/story-KRL8vkUip0HFwYTcpXovyH.html|accessdate=15 November 2018|work=[[Hindustan Times]]|date=7 September 2017}}</ref> Mohanlal joined the film three days later.<ref name="IBT">{{cite news|last=James|first=Anu|title=Did you see Mohanlal's sadhu hairdo in Odiyan? Photos leaked from Varanasi set|url=https://www.ibtimes.co.in/did-you-see-mohanlals-sadhu-hairdo-odiyan-photos-leaked-varanasi-set-740434|accessdate=15 November 2018|work=[[International Business Times]]|date=31 August 2017}}</ref> Some scenes were shot at the [[Assi Ghat]] with Mohanlal. Underwater action scenes were filmed in the [[Ganges|Ganges River]]. In Varanasi, the film was extensively shot at the [[Haveli]]s, the lanes, and [[Ghats in Varanasi|the Ghats]]. Sreejaya Nair was also part of this schedule.<ref>{{cite news|last=Vohra|first=Meera|title=South superstar Mohanlal shoots for his film in Banaras|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/lucknow/south-superstar-mohanlal-shoots-for-his-film-in-banaras/articleshow/60309542.cms|accessdate=19 November 2018|work=[[The Times of India]]|date=1 September 2017}}</ref> In the film, Odiyan Manikyan spent 15 years in the sacred lands of Varanasi before returning to his native village, [[Thenkurissi (gram panchayat)|Thenkurissi]].<ref>{{cite news|last=R.|first=Manoj Kumar|title=Mohanlal's Odiyan shooting begins, filmmakers promise a 'treat for audience'|url=https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/malayalam/mohanlal-odiyan-shooting-begins-filmmakers-promise-a-treat-for-audience-4814418/|accessdate=28 August 2017|work=[[The Indian Express]]|date=26 August 2017}}</ref> This period of his life, his older age, was filmed there. After completing, the crew left Varanasi by the end of the month and remaining was the scenes in Thenkurissi.<ref name="IBT"/> Since the film wanted a period setting, the modern-day Thenkurissi was unsuitable for filming. Hence, the village was recreated in a 20 acre land in Mucheeri, [[Palakkad district]].<ref name="NFW1"/> The second schedule in Palakkad was scheduled to begin on 6 September.<ref>{{cite news|title=ഒടിയൻ അടുത്ത ശനിയാഴ്ച തുടങ്ങും, നായിക മഞ്ജു തന്നെ|url=http://news.keralakaumudi.com/beta/news.php?NewsId=TkNSUDAxNzI5MTU=&xP=Q1lC&xDT=MjAxNy0wOC0xOSAwODo1ODowMA==&xD=MQ==&cID=OQ==|accessdate=15 November 2018|work=[[Kerala Kaumudi]]|date=19 August 2017|archiveurl=http://news.keralakaumudi.com/beta/news.php?NewsId=TkNSUDAxNzI5MTU=&xP=Q1lC&xDT=MjAxNy0wOC0xOSAwODo1ODowMA==&xD=MQ==&cID=OQ==|archivedate=21 August 2017|language=ml}}</ref> Raj joined the film with Mohanlal and Warrier in the banks of [[Bharathappuzha]] on 9 September.<ref>{{cite web|last=Menon|first=V. A. Shrikumar|title=Legends join the sets of #Odiyan on the banks of Nila. Blessed day!!|url=https://www.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=10155229840223509&id=658883508|website=[[Facebook]]|publisher=V A Shrikumar Menon|accessdate=15 November 2018|date=9 September 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Mitra|first=Shilajit|title=#WOAH! Prakash Raj joins the shoot of Mohanlal's fantasy-thriller 'Odiyan'!|url=https://www.timesnownews.com/entertainment/south-gossip/article/mohanlal-odiyan-prakash-raj-shrikumar-menon-manju-warrier-thriller-dark-fantasy/158960|accessdate=15 November 2018|work=[[Times Now]]|date=12 September 2017}}</ref> A champion goat named Madurai Machadaiyan was used in the film.<ref>{{cite news|last=Sidhardhan|first=Sanjith|title=Mohanlal's Odiyan has another champion performer – a fiesty goat|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/malayalam/movies/news/mohanlals-odiyan-has-another-champion-performer-a-fiesty-goat/articleshow/60718570.cms|accessdate=15 November 2018|work=[[The Times of India]]|date=17 September 2017}}</ref>
The film's climax portions was filmed from 6 October in Palakkad, which was scheduled to last for 25 days.<ref>{{cite news|author=Web desk|title=മമോഹൻലാലിന്റെ 'ഒടിയൻ' ക്ലൈമാക്സിലേക്ക്|url=https://malayalam.indianexpress.com/entertainment/mohanlal-next-big-ticket-odiyan-climax-filming/|accessdate=15 November 2018|work=[[Indian Express Malayalam]]|date=7 October 2017|language=ml}}</ref> It was completed in 22 days on 27 October. By this schedule, Odiyan Manikyan's sexagenarian scenes were over and younger scenes were remaining to be shot.<ref>{{cite news|author=Onmanorama staff|title=Mohanlal sheds pounds the French way for 'Odiyan'|url=https://english.manoramaonline.com/entertainment/entertainment-news/2017/10/28/mohanlal-odiyan-special-french-trainer.html|accessdate=15 November 2018|work=[[Malayala Manorama]]|date=28 October 2017}}</ref> Climax scenes were shot in four locations.<ref name="TNIE">{{cite news|last=Suresh|first=Meera|title=Mohanlal's Odiyan isn't a horror movie, but a mass entertainer, says director Shrikumar Menon|url=http://www.newindianexpress.com/entertainment/malayalam/2017/nov/28/mohanlals-odiyan-isnt-a-horror-movie-but-a-mass-entertainer-says-director-shrikumar-menon-1712550.html|accessdate=15 November 2018|work=[[The New Indian Express]]|date=28 November 2017}}</ref> The climax fight sequence was filmed inside an [[Indian banyan]] tree beside the base of empty [[Walayar Dam]]. Action choreographer Peter Hein had around 60 days work in ''Odiyan''.<ref name="NFW2"/> Hein later commented that ''Odiyan'' is his best work to date.<ref>{{cite news|title='Odiyan' stunts would be a response to Hollywood: Peter Hein|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/malayalam/movies/news/odiyan-stunts-would-be-a-response-to-hollywood-peter-hein/articleshow/64112249.cms|accessdate=15 November 2018|work=[[The Times of India]]|agency=Times News Network|date=10 May 2018}}</ref> The film contains five action scenes.<ref name="DC">{{cite news|last=Chandran|first=Cynthia|title=Pranav Mohanlal's Aadi: A launch befitting a prince|url=https://www.deccanchronicle.com/entertainment/mollywood/060717/pranav-mohanlals-aadi-a-launch-befitting-a-prince.html|accessdate=21 November 2018|work=[[Deccan Chronicle]]|date=6 July 2017}}</ref> After the second schedule, Mohanlal took break from filming for his physical transformation to become the younger Odiyan Manikyan.<ref>{{cite news|author=Express web desk|title=Mohanlal undergoing intense fitness training for Odiyan, to lose 15 kg|url=https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/malayalam/mohanlal-undergoing-intense-fitness-training-for-odiyan-to-lose-15-kg-4913859/|accessdate=15 November 2018|work=[[The Indian Express]]|date=30 October 2017}}</ref> He began weight loss training under the supervision of a 22-member [[Personal trainer|personal training]] team from France. After 51 days, he lost {{convert|18|kg|lb}}.<ref>{{cite news|last=Aiyappan|first=Ashameera|title=Odiyan teaser: Mohanlal's new look is absolutely stunning|url=https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/malayalam/mohanlal%E2%80%8F-odiyan-teaser-4980538/|accessdate=15 November 2018|work=[[The Indian Express]]|date=13 December 2017}}</ref>
In meantime, the third schedule began by filming night scenes on 12 November in the absence of Mohanlal.<ref>{{cite news|author=Digital Native|title=Mohanlal preparing for new look in 'Odiyan'|url=https://www.thenewsminute.com/article/mohanlal-preparing-new-look-odiyan-71723|accessdate=15 November 2018|work=[[The News Minute]]|date=16 November 2017}}</ref> The film completed 50 days shooting by 20 November.<ref>{{cite news|last=Sundar|first=Priyanka|title=Odiyan second teaser: Mohanlal introduces us to Manikyan from Thenkurissi|url=https://www.hindustantimes.com/regional-movies/odiyan-second-teaser-mohanlal-introduces-us-to-manikyan-from-thenkurissi/story-rarkIyZ7t1Zz2mz1hreBvO.html|accessdate=15 November 2018|work=[[Hindustan Times]]|date=23 November 2017}}</ref> Mohanlal was to join the sets in December for the fourth schedule.<ref name=TNIE/> However, the schedule had to be postponed for two more months due to scheduling conflicts with Raj's dates.<ref>{{cite web|last=Suresh|first=K.|title=ശരീരപീഡകളേറ്റ് വാങ്ങി മോഹൻലാൽ|url=https://www.magzter.com/IN/NANA-FILM-WEEKLY/Nana-Film/Entertainment/274275|website=[[Magzter]]|publisher=Nana Film Weekly|accessdate=15 November 2018|date=22 April 2018|language=ml|subscription=yes}}</ref> Finally, the schedule commenced on 3 March 2018.<ref>{{cite web|last=Menon|first=Shrikumar|title=Odiyan last schedule starts today.. need all your blessings |url=https://twitter.com/VA_Shrikumar/status/970148046968307712|publisher=[[Twitter]]|accessdate=15 November 2018|date=3 March 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|author1=Web desk|title=ഒടിയൻ അവസാന ഷെഡ്യൂൾ ഇന്നാരംഭിക്കും; വെളിപ്പെടുത്തലുമായി സംവിധായകൻ|url=https://malayalam.indianexpress.com/entertainment/mohanlal-movie-odiyan-final-schedule-will-start-today-says-director-srikumar-menon/|accessdate=15 November 2018|work=[[Indian Express Malayalam]]|date=4 March 2018|language=ml}}</ref> Scenes featuring the younger ages of Odiyan Manikyan, Prabha and Ravunni were filmed in this part.<ref>{{cite news|last=Sidhardhan|first=Sanjith|title=Mohanlal’s Odiyan to start its final schedule in February 5|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/malayalam/movies/news/mohanlals-odiyan-to-start-its-final-schedule-in-february-5/articleshow/62473731.cms|accessdate=15 November 2018|work=[[The Times of India]]|date=12 January 2018}}</ref> Sana Althaf, Kailash, Narain, Siddique, and Innocent also joined the sets.<ref>{{cite news|title=Prakash Raj to join Odiyan in its final schedule|url=http://www.newindianexpress.com/entertainment/malayalam/2018/feb/20/prakash-raj-to-join-odiyan-in-its-final-schedule-1775835.html|accessdate=15 November 2018|work=[[The New Indian Express]]|agency=Express News Service|date=20 February 2018}}</ref> It was also the final schedule, during which 1960–1970 period was filmed in Palakkad.<ref>{{cite news|author=Web desk|title=അത്ഭുതം സൃഷ്ടിക്കാനൊരുങ്ങി ശ്രീകുമാർ മേനോൻ; മലയാളത്തിലെ ഏറ്റവും ചെലവുള്ള ചിത്രമായി ഒടിയൻ; കാണാം ലൊക്കേഷൻ ചിത്രങ്ങൾ|url=http://www.reporterlive.com/2018/03/10/480840.html|accessdate=15 November 2018|work=[[Reporter TV]]|date=10 March 2018|language=ml}}</ref> Odiyan Manikyan's house was created in [[Kollengode, Palakkad|Kollengode]], which is also the native place of screenwriter Harikrishnan.<ref name="deepika"/>
Olappamanna Mana, an [[illam]] situated in [[Vellinezhi]], served as a location in March.<ref>{{cite news|author=Correspondent|title=Famed lensman meets Mohanlal at Odiyan shoot|url=https://english.manoramaonline.com/entertainment/entertainment-news/2018/03/17/pulitzer-winning-photographer-nick-ut-visits-mohanlal-at-odiyan-shooting-location.html|accessdate=15 November 2018|work=[[Malayala Manorama]]|date=17 March 2018}}</ref> The song sequence featuring Mohanlal and Warrier was filmed at the [[Athirappilly Falls]] towards the end of the month.<ref>{{cite news|author=സ്വന്തം ലേഖകൻ|title=മുഖത്ത് ചായം തേച്ച് മോഹൻലാൽ: ഒടിയൻ പാട്ട് ആതിരപ്പള്ളിയിൽ|url=https://www.manoramaonline.com/music/music-news/2018/03/28/odiyan-song-making.html|accessdate=15 November 2018|work=[[Malayala Manorama]]|date=28 March 2018|language=ml}}</ref> A temple-like set was created for the song under the waterfall.<ref>{{cite news|author=സ്വന്തം ലേഖകൻ|title='ഒടിയന്റെ' ഇതുവരെ കാണാത്ത ലുക്കിൽ മോഹൻലാൽ അതിരപ്പിള്ളിയിൽ; ചിത്രങ്ങൾ വൈറൽ|url=https://www.manoramanews.com/news/entertainment/2018/03/29/mohanlal-new-look-in-odiyan.html |accessdate=15 November 2018|work=[[Manorama News]]|date=29 March 2018|language=ml}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|author=Web desk|title=ഒടിയൻ അതിരപ്പിള്ളിയിൽ, ഇനി മാണിക്യന്റെയും പ്രഭയുടെയും പ്രണയം|url=http://www.reporterlive.com/2018/03/28/487117.html|accessdate=15 November 2018|work=[[Reporter TV]]|date=28 March 2018|language=ml}}</ref> In early April, the scene where Odiyan Manikyan swam underwater across the Thenkurissi river was filmed.<ref>{{cite news|title=Mohanlal does dangerous stunts for 'Odiyan' without dupe|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/malayalam/movies/news/mohanlal-does-dangerous-stunts-for-odiyan-without-dupe/articleshow/63642955.cms|accessdate=13 November 2018|work=[[The Times of India]]|agency=Times News Network|date=6 April 2018}}</ref> Manoj Joshi joined the sets in the month.<ref>{{cite news|author=CE Features|title=National Award winner Manoj Joshi joins Odiyan|url=http://www.cinemaexpress.com/stories/news/2018/apr/22/national-award-winner-manoj-joshi-joins-odiyan-5660.html |accessdate=15 November 2018|work=[[The New Indian Express]]|date=22 April 2018}}</ref> Filming also took place in [[Vagamon]], [[Idukki district]].<ref>{{cite news|author=Web desk|title='ഒടിയൻ' ചിത്രീകരണം പൂർത്തിയായി|url=https://malayalam.indianexpress.com/entertainment/mohanlal-movie-odiyan-shooting-completed/|accessdate=15 November 2018|work=[[Indian Express Malayalam]]|date=26 April 2018|language=ml}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=ഓടിയന്റെ 123 ദിനങ്ങൾ; ചിത്രീകരണം പൂർത്തിയായി|url=https://www.deepika.com/Cinema/CinemaNews.aspx?odiyan-movie-shootng-completed&ID=1627|accessdate=15 November 2018|work=[[Deepika (newspaper)|Deepika]]|date=26 April 2018|language=ml}}</ref> Principal photography was completed by 25 April after 123 days of shooting. Final schedule alone lasted 50 days.<ref>{{cite news|title=It's a wrap for Mohanlal's Odiyan|url=http://www.newindianexpress.com/entertainment/malayalam/2018/apr/27/its-a-wrap-for-mohanlals-odiyan-1806841.html|accessdate=15 November 2018|work=The New Indian Express|agency=Express News Service|date=27 April 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|author=Digital Native|title='It's been a meaningful journey', says Mohanlal as 'Odiyan' shoot wrapped up|url=https://www.thenewsminute.com/article/its-been-meaningful-journey-says-mohanlal-odiyan-shoot-wrapped-80367|accessdate=15 November 2018|work=[[The News Minute]]|date=28 April 2018}}</ref> Filming was held in [[Malampuzha]] during the final [[Wrap (filmmaking)|wrap]]. Later, some [[Pick-up (filmmaking)|pick-up]] footage was shot in May.<ref>{{cite web|last=Mananthavady|first=Dhipin|title=ഒടിയൻ 251 പിന്നിട്ട ദിനങ്ങൾ|url=https://www.magzter.com/IN/Kalakaumudi-Publications-Pvt-Ltd/Vellinakshatram/Entertainment/283973|website=[[Magzter]]|publisher=[[Vellinakshatram (magazine)|Vellinakshatram]]|accessdate=15 November 2018|pages=6 – 9|language=ml|date=3 June 2018|subscription=yes}}</ref> After four months and post-production, an additional three-day brief schedule took place from 18 to 20 October in [[Kochi]]. Mohanlal also joined.<ref>{{cite news|author=Web desk|title='ഒടിയൻ' അവസാന മൂന്നു ദിവസത്തെ ചിത്രീകരണം തുടങ്ങി, മോഹൻലാൽ ഇന്ന് ചേരും|url=https://malayalam.indianexpress.com/entertainment/mohanlal-odiyan-shooting/|accessdate=15 November 2018|work=[[Indian Express Malayalam]]|date=19 October 2018|language=ml}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|author=Web desk|title=ഇതാണ് 'ഒടിയന്റെ' രൂപവും ഭാവവും; ചിത്രീകരണം പൂർത്തിയായിി|url=https://malayalam.indianexpress.com/entertainment/mohanlal-odiyan-shoot-wrapped-up-va-shrikumar-menon/|accessdate=15 November 2018|work=[[Indian Express Malayalam]]|date=21 October 2018|language=ml}}</ref> The film in its entirety was completed in 145 days shooting.<ref>{{cite news|author=മനോരമ ലേഖകൻ|title=145 ദിവസത്തെ ചിത്രീകരണം, ഒന്നര വര്‍ഷത്തെ അധ്വാനം; ഒടിയന്‍ വരുന്നു|url=https://www.manoramaonline.com/movies/movie-news/2018/10/22/odiyan-shooting-completed-shrikumar-menon-mohanlal.html|accessdate=15 November 2018|work=[[Malayala Manorama]]|date=22 October 2018|language=ml}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|author=Correspondent|title=Watch Peter Hein drifting a Brezza on Odiyan sets|url=https://english.manoramaonline.com/business/autos/2018/10/28/watch-peter-hein-drifting-a-brezza-on-odiyan-sets.html|accessdate=15 November 2018|work=[[Malayala Manorama]]|date=29 October 2018}}</ref>
===Post-production=== The film's post-production took place in [[Mumbai]], [[Chennai]] and Kochi.<ref>{{cite news|title=Director Shrikumar Menon falls from escalator, seriously injured|url=https://english.mathrubhumi.com/movies-music/movie-news/director-shrikumar-menon-falls-from-escalator-seriously-injured-1.3322781|accessdate=22 November 2018|work=[[Mathrubhumi]]|date=19 November 2018}}</ref> Mumbai-based company [[NY VFXWAALA]] provided the visual effects for the film.<ref>{{cite news|last=Pudipeddi|first1=Haricharan|title=Award-winning VFX studio roped in for Mohanlal's Odiyan|url=https://www.hindustantimes.com/regional-movies/award-winning-vfx-studio-roped-in-for-mohanlal-s-odiyan/story-dzctyBRxZy4cQisdhqmRkL.html|accessdate=22 November 2018|work=[[Hindustan Times]]|date=21 December 2017}}</ref> [[Prasad Sutar]] was the [[visual effects supervisor]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Sutar|first=Prasad|title=My next as #Vfx supervisor & first with @Mohanlal sir #Odiyan @nyvfxwaala |url=https://twitter.com/vfxwaala/status/881961841232011264|website=[[Twitter]]|publisher=Prasad Sutar|accessdate=22 November 2018}}</ref> An early estimate for the cost of visual effects during pre-production was {{INR}}7 crore.<ref name="mangalam"/> The film without the computer graphics and actions scenes were used during the [[Dubbing (filmmaking)|dubbing]] process. The film was edited by [[Johnkutty]]. The length of the screenplay matched with the runtime of the film and none of the scenes in the screenplay were to be removed while editing.<ref name="deepika"/> The [[Audio mixing (recorded music)|final mixing]] of the songs was undergoing in August 2018.<ref>{{cite news|title=Proud to be a part of Odiyan: M Jayachandran|url=http://www.newindianexpress.com/entertainment/malayalam/2018/aug/10/proud-to-be-a-part-of-odiyan-m-jayachandran-1856030.html|accessdate=21 November 2018|work=[[The New Indian Express]]|agency=Express News Service|date=10 August 2018}}</ref>
== Soundtrack == {{Infobox album | name = Odiyan | type = Soundtrack | artist = [[M. Jayachandran]] | cover = | alt = | released = | recorded = 2017–2018 | venue = | studio = | genre = [[Feature film soundtrack]] | length = | language = [[Malayalam]] | label = [[Satyam Audios|Satyam Videos]] | producer = | chronology = [[M. Jayachandran]] | prev_title = | prev_year = | next_title = | next_year = | misc = {{Singles | name = Odiyan | type = Soundtrack | single1 = Kondoram | single1date = 18 November 2018 | single2 = | single2date = }} }} The [[background score]] for the film was composed by [[Sam C. S.]], making his debut in Malayalam cinema.<ref>{{cite news|last=Suganth|first=M.|title=Sam CS composes a single for horror anthology|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/tamil/music/sam-cs-composes-a-single-for-horror-anthology/articleshow/61403985.cms|accessdate=21 November 2018|work=[[The Times of India]]|date=2 November 2017}}</ref> The film also features five songs composed by [[M. Jayachandran]], the lyrics were written by [[Rafeeq Ahamed]] and Lakshmi Shrikumar.<ref name="DC"/> "Kondoram", a duet from the film was sung by [[Shreya Ghoshal]] and [[Sudeep Kumar]], and written by Ahamed.<ref>{{cite news|title=Mohanlal reveals a secret about Manju. Watch this lyrical video song from 'Odiyan' to know more!|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/malayalam/movies/news/mohanlal-reveals-a-secret-about-manju-watch-this-lyrical-video-song-from-odiyan-to-know-more/articleshow/66692879.cms|accessdate=21 November 2018|work=[[The Times of India]]|agency=Times News Network|date=19 November 2018}}</ref> The other four songs were sung by Ghoshal, [[Shankar Mahadevan]], [[M. G. Sreekumar]], and [[Mohanlal]] each.<ref>{{cite news|last=Jayaram|first=Deepika|title=Mohanlal sings a folk song for Odiyan|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/malayalam/music/mohanlal-sings-a-folk-song-for-odiyan/articleshow/65365662.cms|accessdate=21 November 2018|work=[[The Times of India]]|date=11 August 2018}}</ref>
Jayachandran began composing the songs in June 2017.<ref>{{cite news|last=Prakash|first=Asha|title=Mohanlal introduces the songs of Odiyan|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/malayalam/movies/news/mohanlal-introduces-the-songs-of-odiyan/articleshow/59145514.cms|accessdate=2 November 2017|work=[[The Times of India]]|date=14 June 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=ഒടിയനിൽ നാല് ഗാനങ്ങൾ; കന്പോസിംഗ് വീഡിയോ കാണാം|url=https://www.deepika.com/cinema/Trailer-Songs.aspx?ID=48|accessdate=21 November 2018|work=[[Deepika (newspaper)|Deepika]]|date=13 June 2017|language=ml}}</ref> Shankar Mahadevan recorded a song in August.<ref>{{cite news|last=Sidhardhan|first=Sanjith|title=Shankar Mahadevan sings a track for Mohanlal's Odiyan|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/malayalam/movies/news/shankar-mahadevan-sings-a-track-for-mohanlals-odiyan/articleshow/59916398.cms|accessdate=21 November 2018|work=[[The Times of India]]|date=4 August 2017}}</ref> For scoring, Menon chose Sam after he was impressed by his work in ''[[Vikram Vedha]]'' (2017).<ref name="MN">{{cite news|last=ചോടോന്‍|first=രതീഷ്|title=വിക്രം വേദയുടെ ബി.ജി.എമ്മുകാരന്‍ ഇനി ഒടിയനൊപ്പം|url=https://www.manoramanews.com/news/entertainment/2017/11/17/vikram-vedha-composer-sam-cs-to-handle-background-score-in-mohanlal-s-upcoming-thriller-odiyan-17.html|accessdate=22 November 2018|work=[[Manorama News]]|date=17 November 2017|language=ml}}</ref> Sam joined the film after the songs has been already been composed.<ref name=sam>{{cite news|last=Aiyappan|first=Ashameera|title=Mohanlal's Odiyan is a film to be proud of: Sam CS|url=https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/tamil/mohanlal-odiyan-sam-cs-5107044/|accessdate=22 November 2018|work=[[The Indian Express]]|date=22 March 2018}}</ref> He began working on the score in January 2018. Following his usual method, Sam composed the score beforehand based on the screenplay, contrary to the conventional method of scoring the filmed scenes during post-production.<ref>{{cite web|last=Bharadan|title=Music director Sam CS compares his upcoming film with Vikram Vedha|url=https://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movies-cinema-news-16/music-director-sam-cs-compares-his-upcoming-film-with-vikram-vedha.html|publisher=Behindwoods|accessdate=21 November 2018|date=8 January 2018}}</ref> The musical score was then used while filming. Since the film had a period setting, old ethnic musical instruments of [[Kerala]] was utilised in the score.<ref name=sam/><ref>{{cite news|title=Sam CS to compose music for Mohanlal's Odiyan|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/tamil/music/sam-cs-to-compose-music-for-mohanlals-odiyan/articleshow/63543955.cms|accessdate=22 November 2018|work=[[The Times of India]]|date=30 March 2018}}</ref> The film's theme music was chosen from four themes composed by Sam.<ref name="MN"/>

==Release== The film is scheduled to be released worldwide on 14 December 2018.<ref>{{cite news|title=Odiyan trailer to be released along with Kayamkulam Kochunni|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/malayalam/movies/news/odiyan-trailer-to-be-released-along-with-kayamkulam-kochunni/articleshow/65910425.cms|accessdate=9 October 2018|work=The Times of India}}</ref>
===Marketing=== The [[concept art]] of the younger Odiyan Manikyan was revealed through a digital motion poster in July 2017.<ref>{{cite news|last=Acharya|first=Sandeep|title=Odiyan motion poster: Mohanlal looks young, clean-shaven and unrecognizable|url=https://www.hindustantimes.com/regional-movies/odiyan-motion-poster-mohanlal-looks-young-clean-shaven-and-unrecognizable/story-EiSJkuje11oyE0HLw5eGqK.html|accessdate=23 November 2018|work=[[Hindustan Times]]|date=4 July 2017}}</ref> The official marketing campaign of the film began in October 2018 by unveiling a life-size statue of Odiyan Manikyan at [[PVR Cinemas]] in [[Lulu International Shopping Mall]], [[Kochi]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Mohanlal's 'Odiyan' shoot completed|url=http://www.newindianexpress.com/entertainment/malayalam/2018/oct/22/mohanlals-odiyan-shoot-completed-1888204.html|accessdate=22 November 2018|work=[[The New Indian Express]]|agency=Express News Service|date=22 October 2018}}</ref> Statues was later distributed to various releasing theatres in Kerala.<ref>{{cite news|title=More 'Odiyans' on the way|url=https://english.mathrubhumi.com/movies-music/movie-news/more-odiyans-on-the-way-1.3254635|accessdate=22 November 2018|work=[[Mathrubhumi]]|date=26 October 2018}}</ref> The team invited entries from public for a video making contest conceptualised on ''Odiyan'', with prize money ranging from ₹25,000 to ₹1 lakh for the finalists.<ref>{{cite news|title=ഒടിയന്‍ കാണട്ടെ ആരാധകരുടെ ഒടിവിദ്യ, ഒരു ലക്ഷം രൂപ സമ്മാനമെന്ന് മോഹൻലാൽ|url=https://www.mathrubhumi.com/movies-music/news/odiyan-mohanlal-promo-video-manju-warrier-1.3233524|accessdate=1 December 2018|work=[[Mathrubhumi]]|date=17 October 2018|language=ml}}</ref> ''Odiyan'', the mobile application of the film was released.<ref>{{cite web|title=Odiyan for Xmas|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/odiyan-for-xmas-imagegallery-malayalam-slfpz0cahheej.html|publisher=[[Sify]]|accessdate=23 November 2018}}</ref> Aashirvad Cinemas partnered with telecommunications service provider [[Bharti Airtel]] for merchandising ''Odiyan'' branded sim cards and would also conduct other offers and contests through various Airtel services, including access to [[Making-of|behind-the-scenes]] in Airtel TV application.<ref>{{cite news|author=Express News Service|title=Mohanlal-starrer Odiyan to hit 2,000 screens worldwide on December 14|url=http://www.newindianexpress.com/entertainment/malayalam/2018/nov/30/odiyan-to-hit-2000-screens-worldwide-on-dec-14-1905169.html|accessdate=1 December 2018|work=[[The New Indian Express]]|date=30 November 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Airtel ties up with Odiyan, launches special Odiyan products & services|url=http://www.newspatrolling.com/airtel-ties-up-with-odiyan-launches-special-odiyan-products-services/|publisher=NewsPatrolling.com|accessdate=1 December 2018|date=29 November 2018}}</ref>

{{Infobox television |show_name = Os Trapalhões |image = Trapalhoes.jpg |caption = The Trapalhões: Mussum (green shirt), Zacarias (blue and yellow shirt) Dedé (blue shirt) and Didi (white shirt) |producer = [[Rede Globo]] |creator = Wilton Franco |country = [[Brazil]] |network = [[Rede Globo]] |num_seasons = |num_episodes = |first_aired = 1977 |last_aired = 1993 |}}
'''Os Trapalhões''' ({{IPA-pt|us tɾapaˈʎõjs}}) was a [[Brazil]]ian comedy group and also a television series created by Wilton Franco.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://memoriaglobo.globo.com/Memoriaglobo/0,27723,GYN0-5273-257341,00.html|title=A TURMA DO DIDI|work=globo.com|accessdate=25 August 2015}}</ref> Its members were [[Dedé Santana]], [[Zacarias (Os Trapalhões)|Zacarias]], [[Mussum]] and their leader Didi Mocó, that was played by [[Renato Aragão]]. The name ''Os Trapalhões'' (which can be translated as ''The Bumbling Ones'') is derived from the Portuguese verb ''atrapalhar'', which means the opposite of ''[[wikt:helping|helping]]'', ''to do something the wrong way'' or ''to Those that confuse''. The name is translated "Tramps" in English DVD subtitles. It was originally aired by [[Rede Globo]] from 1977 to 1993.
On March 18, 1990, Zacarias died due to respiratory failure, but the group and the series didn't come to an end until July 29, 1994, when Mussum died due to an unsuccessful [[heart transplant]].
==The show== The series consisted of several different minutes scenes featuring comic adventures and situations of the four protagonists, sometimes with just one of them (mostly Didi), two, three and even with all of them, in which they opposed enemies and even each other (these internal fights between them almost every time consisted of Dedé, Mussum and Zacarias against Didi, but Didi, as well as anyone of them who stood by Didi's side, often triumphed over them, very similar to [[Looney Tunes]]' [[Bugs Bunny]] and [[Daffy Duck]] rivalry), played pranks on each other or worked together in order to achieve a common goal. There was also throughout the years of the series, several parodies of [[comics]]' superheroes, like [[Superman]] (mostly played by Didi because of his leader role), [[Batman]] (played mostly by Dedé because of Dedé's second banana role and also because of the [[Homosexuality in the Batman franchise|homosexual interpretations]] about Batman and him), [[Spider-Man]], [[Hulk (comics)|Hulk]], [[The Phantom]], etc.
==Celebrities== [[File:Trapalhoesparody.jpg|thumb|275px|right|Didi (Superman) and Dedé (Batman in his [[Batman (1989 film)|1989 film's]] costume, crouched in front of Superman and barely seen because of his totally black outfit and also because [[Catwoman]]'s black legs are behind him), in a parody of [[The death of Superman]]. At left, [[Robin (comics)|Robin]]'s legs.]]
===Didi=== The leader of the group who however, in some scenes, was treated by his three friends as the most worthless member. A very clever man from [[Ceará]] with a peculiar manner of speaking. He rarely ended the scenes with bad luck or as the loser, in which he "fought" enemies or even his own friends.
===Dedé=== Interpreted as a "second in command" role. He was the most serious one and acted as the brain of the group. His masculinity was always mocked by Didi.
===Mussum=== An [[Afro-Latin American|Afro-Brazilian]] man who was ever proud to say that he came from Morro da Mangueira, a slum in [[Rio de Janeiro]]. He also had a very peculiar vocabulary. His greatest passion being [[cachaça]] (the most common [[distilled beverage]] in Brazil), which he nicknamed "mé" (or "mel", Portuguese for [[honey]]). He was always the butt of jokes and nicknames because of his skin color, as to be sarcastically called ''Maizena'' ([[Corn Starch]]) by Didi or then the latter's insinuations and innuendos comparing his skin color to that of a vulture's, at which Mussum would become verbally (sometimes physically) aggressive and answer back with offensive jokes about Didi's own northern origins or even his own mother.
===Zacarias=== A stocky, little man with child's voice and mannerism — frequently putting on childlike tantrums in face of trouble or even role playing as a kid when the sketch asked for it. He also wore a wig due to baldness. This was exploited in sketches where it would be taken off either by Didi or by any other adversity such as an arrow which, missing his head, stabbed the wig to the wall, for instance.
==Main cast of supporting actors== [[File:Trapalhões2ndcast.jpg|thumb|200px|right|Didi (left), as a waiter, being bullied by Carlos Kurt in one scene.]]
*''[[Dino Santana]]''- Dedé real life's brother. He played several secondary roles throughout the series and in some Trapalhões' films. He died in 2010. *''[[Carlos Kurt]]''- A tall blonde man with a very bad look and huge eyes. He often played [[villain]], [[bullying|bully]] and other enemy roles in the series and also in some Trapalhões' movies. He died in 2003. *''Roberto Guilherme''- An obese and bald man with whom Didi always had fun by taking off his wig. Also played a large number of [[antagonist]] roles, sometimes along Carlos Kurt. Though he played numerous secondary characters, the most memorable of them was the ''Sargento Pincel'' (Sergeant [[Brush]]), who led an army in which the Trapalhões acted as privates. *''[[Tião Macalé]]''- A very funny [[tooth]]less black man that usually ended the scenes saying the word ''Nojento!'' (Portuguese for ''[[Disgusting]]''). This quote make him very famous both in the series and in Brazil. He died in 1993. *''[[Ted Boy Marino]]'' - A [[real-life]] [[wrestler]] with a Spanish [[Accent (dialect)|accent]] (though being of [[Italians|Italian]] origin) and [[haircut]] similar to [[He-Man]]'s. He died in 2012.
==Comics== [[Comic book]] series based on Trapalhões were published in the 80 and 90 respectively by "Bloch Editores" and [[Editora Abril]], usually in [[digest size]].<ref>Ramone, Marcus, (2009-07-09).[http://www.universohq.com/quadrinhos/2009/trapalhoes.cfm Os Trapalhões na Bloch Editores: a história de um clássico dos quadrinhos]{{dead link|date=November 2018}} (portuguese)</ref>
