revision.text:
{{italic title}} '''''Tales of Two People''''' is a collection of short stories and novelettes by [[Anthony Hope]], the author better known as the writer of ''[[The Prisoner of Zenda]]''. It was published in book form in 1907.
The stories included are as follows:
=="Helena’s Path"==
Ambrose Calverley, who has travelled and adventured for many years, returns to England on the death of his father. Inheriting the title and estates of Lord Lynborough, he takes up residence at Scarsmore Castle on the coast of [[Yorkshire]], with his friends Leonard 'Cromlech' Stubb, an ancient history researcher, and Roger Wibraham, his private secretary. Fond of sea bathing, he finds that the path to the beach, the 'Beach Path', which passes through the grounds of Nab Grange (formerly part of the Calverley estate), has been blocked off by the new owner, the widowed Anglo-Italian lady Helena, Marchesa di San Servolo. Although neither meet, a dispute begins between them concerning access to the path. Neither will give way, the lady is prepared to go to court and Lynborough calls her bluff. After a stalemate, Lynborough persuades his friends to pay court to the ladies staying with the Marchesa. Seeing her chance, she applies a similar strategy to Lynborough’s companions, creating a wedge in his resolve. Persuaded by her lawyer that her legal case is very weak, the lady accepts a compromise presented to her by an 'embassy' sent by Lynborough. He demands the right to use the path, if she will allow him to visit her to present his 'homage' once a year on the day of St John Baptist. She graciously accepts. It is implied that they will eventually marry. And the Beach Path is renamed 'Helena’s Path'.
=="Mrs Thistleton’s Princess"==
The story is narrated by Tregaskis, a country [[gentleman]], who is invited to the manor of Mr and Mrs Thistleton to meet the exiled Princess Vera of Boravia. Mr Thistleton, a lawyer, is negotiating for the return of the Princess’s private fortune, but is unsuccessful. To pay off his fee, the impoverished princess is forced to accept the position of [[governess]] in the household, known simply as Fräulein Friedenburg. When a neighbour, an up-and-coming stockbroker, becomes engaged to the eldest daughter of the house, instead of the princess (as she had hoped), she is forced to leave. A respectable situation is found for her, but as she leaves, a revolution breaks out in her country. She travels to Vienna, with expenses paid by Tregaskis, who is the only one who actually believed her story. It transpires later that she has indeed become Queen of Boravia.
=="The Necessary Resources"==
Prince Julian, pretender to the throne of a European country, is living in London with the mysterious Mrs Rivers. Byers, a financial speculator, is persuaded by her to provide support to the prince, but in fact contrives rumours that will cause the country’s stock to rise and fall in value. In the end, the prince does not return to his country, but he does marry Mrs. Rivers. Byers makes a fortune and later stands for Parliament.
=="Miss Gladwin’s Chance"==
Mr Foulkes, a solicitor, narrates the tale of Sir Thomas Gladwin of Worldstone Park, a rich country gentleman. A widower, he is engaged to Nettie Tyler, a girl many times younger than he is, and he has altered his Will in her favour. Four days before the wedding, he is killed in a horse riding accident. The Will has not been formalised and the estate goes to his daughter Beatrice, who had largely been cut out of her inheritance. She allows Nettie to remain on the estate with the uncertain status of 'companion'. A year later, Beatrice accedes to the unspoken feelings of the local 'county set' and makes over £100,000 in her favour. Shortly after, Nettie becomes engaged to neighbouring impoverished landowner Captain Spencer Fullard who had once paid court to Beatrice. She reveals to Foulkes that she did it to stop Fullard proposing marriage to herself.
=="The Prince Consort"==
The narrator tells of the Clinton family. Mrs Clinton is a well-known novelist and a centre of literary society, whilst her husband is content to live in her shadow. He has let it be known that he also 'writes', but nothing much is known of what he writes. Eventually, a large two-volume work emerges and is taken up by his wife’s publishers more as a favour than anything else. The work is an unexpected success and the gaze of the literary set turns from Mrs Clinton to her Husband.
=="What was expected of Miss Constantine"==
Katherine Constantine is rich, pretty and the object of interest to two men; Valentine Hare of the [[Colonial Office]], and Oliver Kirby, also in the government. She is proposed to by Hare, but she keeps him waiting for an answer. Family and friends all volunteer opinions and advice. She discusses the matter with a friend, Mr Wynne. When Hare is elevated to the Secretaryship for the Colonies, Miss Constantine decides to marry Kirby. They immediately leave for Canada, where Kirby hopes to enter politics.
=="Slim-Fingered Jim"==
Gentleman thief James Walsh, known as Slim-Fingered Jim, has been convicted for involvement in a [[Bond (finance)|bond]] robbery and sentenced to seven years in prison. In a country house garden one evening, Mrs Pryce confides to a friend that she met Walsh several years previously on a ship travelling from America. She was much taken with his suave and debonair manner, even after he confessed to her his involvement in a swindle. He was later arrested but found not guilty. She hopes that he can tolerate his prison sentence.
=="The Grey Frock"==
The Petheram family are landed gentry, but as a large family, their expenditure exceeds their income. One daughter has already married into the aristocracy, but Winifred chooses to become engaged to Harold Jackson, who has a small income only. Harold takes Winifred to London to see the house he proposes to rent for them. It’s the best they can afford, but Winifred is horrified at the small size and dirtiness of the proposed home. She is even more horrified that Harold has ignored the new grey costume she has specially worn for the occasion. She breaks the engagement, and it is implied that she may marry a wealthy former suitor instead.
=="Foreordained"==
One evening in a London club, The Colonel relates a story of a friend, George Langhorn, who inherited the ownership of Stretchleys, a high-class [[Savile Row]] tailor, but hates it. He is persuaded to take a break in [[Monte Carlo]], where he meets the pretty and rich Miss Minnie Welford. It transpires that she has inherited half-ownership of a mass-production clothing company Sky-High Tailoring, which she also hates. The couple quickly become engaged and marry. One of the Colonel’s listeners, a lawyer, then reveals that the week before, the companies amalgamated, with Langhorn as Chairman of the joint concern.
=="Prudence and the Bishop"==
Miss Prudence, eldest daughter of a vicar with a large family, is expected to marry money. She discusses with a friend the chances of her husband-to-be becoming a bishop.
=="The Opened Door"==
A passenger on a sinking ship debates with himself whether or not to surrender to his fate. A scoundrel of some sort who has escaped trial and prison, he eventually drowns.
=="Love’s Logic"==
In a short dramatic scene, a man who has just avoided proposing marriage, and a lady who has just refused a proposal, meet and discuss their various failures.
=="La Mort À La Mode"==
Monsieur Le Duc and Madame La Marquise are being taken to their execution during the [[French Revolution]]. They exchange words and comfort each other before they mount the scaffold.
=="The Riddle of Countess Runa"==
The walled city of Or is being besieged by King Stanislas, but the ruler of the city, Countess Runa, has held out and defied the King’s angry demands. She claims that the city cannot be defeated until a [[riddle]] she has presented to him is solved. A prisoner is brought to her, who claims to be a renegade from the King’s army. He is given sanctuary for seven days and nights and will be released if he has solved the riddle. On the final morning, he reveals himself to be the King, as Runa had known all along, and proposes a truce. And so peace reigns in the Kingdom.
=="The Lady and the Flagon"==
The rich young Duke of Belleville (pronounced Bevvle) visits his villa near [[Hampstead Heath]], but late at night, he feels lonely and bored. He bribes a passing policeman to change clothes with him and goes on patrol to check the doors and windows of his neighbours. Returning, he sees a young man outside his villa. He claims that he’s the Duke of Belleville (pronounced Bevvle) who has lost his key. Intrigued, the real Duke assists the imposter to enter. It's soon clear that he knows about, and plans to steal, the valuable 'Queen Bess Flagon'. A young lady, clearly an accomplice, arrives in a brougham. The real Duke changes clothes back with the policeman, snatches the flagon and runs across the heath, chased by the imposter. The chasers are confronted by a real policeman, an inspector who lives nearby; he recognises the fake Duke of Belleville (pronounced Bevvle) as a confidence trickster and arrests him. The real Duke, heartily enlivened by the night’s excitement, refuses to prefer charges and the would-be thief is allowed to go free. He graciously presents the flagon to the (still anonymous) lady and she also leaves.
=="The Duke’s Allotment"==
The Duke, again bored with life, decides to take a small [[cottage]] and [[Allotment (gardening)|allotment]] in a country district and pass himself off as an out-of-work labourer. Unused to physical work, he is soon exhausted from his digging, and is visited by a formidable lady who believes him to be a drunkard. Affecting a [[Somersetshire]] accent, the Duke enjoys the deception. The lady sends her daughter to try to reform him. The house is later surrounded by other neighbours and police who have mistaken him for a thief believed to have burgled silver plate from a nearby manor house. The Duke takes to his heels, pursued by the local [[Chief Constable]] and others, but evades them. He returns home, accompanied by the lady, and resumes his true identity, much to her amusement.
==References== {{nofootnotes|date=September 2014}} *{{Cite book|author=Lancelyn Green, Roger |title=Introduction to Prisoner of Zenda & Rupert of Hentzau| year=1966 |publisher=[[J. M. Dent|J. M. Dent & Sons]]|series=[[Everyman's Library]] |ref=CITEREFLancelyn Green1966|authorlink=Roger Lancelyn Green}} This six-page introduction is primarily a biography, and includes a detailed bibliography, both of Hope's oeuvre and of biography and criticism concerning him. *{{Cite web |url=http://www.oxforddnb.com/view/article/33769 |title= Hawkins, Sir Anthony Hope <nowiki>[</nowiki>pseud. Anthony Hope<nowiki>]</nowiki> (1863–1933) |accessdate=1 February 2010 |last= Taylor |first=Clare L. |year= 2004 |work= [[Dictionary of National Biography#Oxford Dictionary of National Biography|Oxford Dictionary of National Biography]] |publisher= [[Oxford University Press]] |doi= 10.1093/ref:odnb/33769 |ref=CITEREFTaylor2004}}
==External links== {{Commons category|Anthony Hope Hawkins}} * {{gutenberg author| id=Anthony+Hope | name=Anthony Hope}} * {{IMDb title|0197907|Sophy of Kravonia}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2010}} [[Category:1907 short story collections]] [[Category:British short story collections]] [[Category:Single-writer short story collections]] [[Category:Adventure fiction]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=July 2018}} {{Infobox adult biography | name = Tanya Tate | image = Tanya Tate 2015.jpg | caption = Tanya Tate at the 2015 [[Exxxotica]] Expo in Dallas, Texas on 9 August 2015 | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1979|3|31|df=yes}}<ref name=iafd>{{iafd name|id=TanyaTate|name=Tanya Tate|gender=female}}</ref> | birth_place = [[Liverpool]], England, UK<ref name=iafd/> | death_date = | death_place = | spouse = | height = {{height|ft=5|in=6}}<ref name=iafd/> | weight = {{convert|125|lb|kg|abbr=on}}<ref name=iafd/> | alias = Tanya Thomas, Sue<ref name=iafd/> | years_active = 2009–present | website = {{official URL}} }} '''Tanya Tate''' (born 31 March 1979 in [[Liverpool]], England) is the [[stage name]] of an English [[glamour model]], writer, international [[cosplayer]], and [[pornographic film actor|pornographic actress]]. She entered the British adult industry in 2009<ref name="SmutLife">[http://smutlife.com/mag/interviews/british-bombshell-tanya-tate/ “Tanya Tate Interview”] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100625052516/http://smutlife.com/mag/interviews/british-bombshell-tanya-tate/ |date=25 June 2010 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.independent.ie/national-news/online-reality-show-where-a-star-is-porn-1829679.html|title=Online reality show where a star is porn|last=Tom Prendeville|date=July 2009|work=Irish Independent |accessdate=24 March 2011}}</ref> and now divides her time between [[London]] and [[Los Angeles]]. Her stage name is inspired by her interest in comic books and by the way in which [[Stan Lee]] gave his characters first and last names with the same initial.<ref name="INGInterview" /> Tate is best known for her appearances in the [[MILF pornography|MILF]] genre; she has nine ''MILF of the Year'' wins to her credit.<ref name="2014MILF">{{cite web|last=Staff|title=Tanya Tate Wins MILF of the Year at 2014 Fanny Awards|url=http://business.avn.com/company-news/Tanya-Tate-Wins-MILF-of-the-Year-at-2014-Fanny-Awards-556692.html|publisher=Adult Video News|accessdate=11 May 2014}}</ref>
==Career== After beginning her porn career in 2009, Tate began contributing to a regular column for British adult magazine ''Ravers DVD'' in 2010.<ref name=AVN>{{cite web|url=http://business.avn.com/company-news/UK-XXX-Glamour-Model-TANYA-TATE-Pens-Column-For-RAVERS-DVD-Magazine-397089.html |title=Tanya Tate Pens Column for 'Ravers DVD' Magazine|work=avn.com|accessdate=4 March 2015}}</ref> She is perhaps best known for her contributions to the [[MILF pornography|MILF]] genre of the adult industry with numerous award wins. Tate is also known for her appearances in [[Pornographic parody film|porn parodies]] such as ''Game of Bones'' (an adult parody of ''[[Game of Thrones]]''), ''[[Vivid Superhero|The Incredible Hulk XXX]]'', and ''[[Vivid Superhero|Iron Man XXX]]''.<ref name=iafd/><ref name=2014MILF/>
Later that same year Tate made headlines in [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]], after it was discovered that one of the amateur men who participated in the filming of her [[Television X]] series ''Tanya Tate’s Sex Tour of Ireland'', was [[Gaelic Athletic Association]] player Greg Jacobs. Tate travelled the countryside in a camper van meeting genuine Irish men and filmed both softcore and [[hardcore pornography]].<ref name=TelevisionX>{{cite web|url=http://www.televisionx.com/2010/04/tanya-tates-sex-tour-of-ireland-teaser/ |accessdate=24 March 2011| title=Tanya Tate’s Sex Tour Of Ireland Teaser |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100425164307/http://www.televisionx.com/2010/04/tanya-tates-sex-tour-of-ireland-teaser/ |archivedate=25 April 2010 }}</ref> Jacobs denied that he appeared in the video,<ref name=DailyMail>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1284335/GAA-star-camper-van-porn-scandal-Hurler-s-guest-role-video-sex-tour-Ireland.html|title=GAA star in camper van porn scandal: Hurler¿s guest role in video 'sex tour of Ireland'|work=''Daily Mail'' Online|accessdate=4 March 2015}}</ref> but then admitted, "I don't regret doing it", noting that he didn't want his parents to know. He appeared in the video following a dare from his friends.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/news/local-national/hurler-in-porn-movie-row-14832450.html|title=Hurler Greg Jacob in porn movie row|date=7 June 2010|work=Belfast Telegraph|accessdate=24 March 2011}}</ref> ''Tanya Tate's Casting Couch'' series ended in March 2013.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.sex.com/news/blog/tanya-tate-cosplay-queen/ |title=Tanya Tate, Cosplay Queen » The Sex.com Blog |publisher=Sex.com |date= |accessdate=29 December 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130607103739/http://www.sex.com/news/blog/tanya-tate-cosplay-queen/ |archivedate=7 June 2013 }}</ref>
Tate directed her first film for [[Filly Films (studio)|Filly Films]]<ref>{{cite web|last=Staff|title=Tanya Tate Director profile|url=http://www.fillyfilms.com/video/tanya-tate/|publisher=Filly FIlms|accessdate=10 January 2014}}</ref> called ''Tanya Tate's the MILF Masseuse'' in 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://business.avn.com/articles/video/Tanya-Tate-Makes-Directorial-Debut-Releases-Cover-Art-450710.html|title=Tanya Tate Makes Directorial Debut; Releases Cover Art|date=12 October 2011|work=|accessdate=12 December 2012}}</ref> Her work as director for Filly Films continued in 2012 with two titles ''Tanya Tate's Runaways'' and ''Tanya Tate's Tea & Muffin Party''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fillyfilms.com/video/tanya-tate/|title=Tanya Tate, Director|date=12 December 2012|work=|accessdate=12 December 2012}}</ref>
Tate is outspoken about her industry and was quoted in a story about the [[30th AVN Awards|2013 AVN Awards]] for which she was nominated for an award. She stated, "If you are more popular with the fans, companies are more likely to book you for their production", and that "Being nominated for awards help build your recognition with your fan base. People that win male and female performer of the year are generally solid consistent talent that are open to many 'levels,' and some of these performers already have higher basic rates than others".<ref>{{cite web|last=Moye|first=David|title=Asa Akira Proud To Be Nominated Porn Industry's 'Performer Of The Year'|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/01/19/asa-akira_n_2471858.html|publisher=Huffington Post|accessdate=4 February 2014}}</ref>
On 5 December 2013, Tate was the host of the 4th annual [[SHAFTA Awards (adult video)|SHAFTA Awards]] at the Rise [[Superclub]] in [[Leicester Square]]. She was also nominated for several awards that night and won ''MILF of the Year'' for the fourth year running.<ref>{{cite web|last=Staff|title=Nominations Announced for 4th Annual SHAFTA Awards|url=http://business.avn.com/company-news/Nominations-Announced-for-4th-Annual-SHAFTA-Awards-535826.html|publisher=Adult Video News|accessdate=11 February 2014}}</ref> Then in January 2014, Tate was France's [[Hot Vidéo]] magazine correspondent conducting red-carpet interviews at the [[AVN Award]]s.<ref name=2014AVNRedCarpet>{{cite web|last1=Staff|title=Hot Video Taps Tanya Tate for AVN Awards Red Carpet Interviews|url=http://business.avn.com/company-news/Hot-Video-Taps-Tanya-Tate-for-AVN-Awards-Red-Carpet-Interviews-541392.html|website=AVN.com|publisher=Adult Video News|accessdate=26 August 2014}}</ref>
===Cosplay=== [[File:Long Beach Comic Expo 2012 - She-Ra.jpg|thumb|Long Beach Comic Expo 2012 as [[She-Ra]]|267x267px]]
Since her 2010 San Diego [[ComicCon]] convention debut dressed as [[Emma Frost]], Tate has gained the attention of several media outlets, from [[Life.com]], [[Getty Images]], [[KTLA]].com and the [[Orange County Register]] to [[BleedingCool.com]], NerdReactor.com, Cosmic Book News and GirlsGoneComic.com, as a [[cosplayer]]. Earlier in the year, Tate was featured by [[IGN.com]] in an interview article called ''Tanya Tate: Cosplayer Extraordinaire''.<ref name=INGInterview>{{cite web|last=Ng|first=Stephen|title=Tanya Tate: Cosplayer Extraordinaire|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2011/06/06/tanya-tate-cosplayer-extraordinaire|publisher=ING|accessdate=11 February 2014}}</ref> In that interview, she explains how the stage name she uses for her adult industry performances was inspired by how comic book writer Stan Lee named his characters using the same letter in their first and last names. Tate was also named the ''Cosplay Girl of the Month'' by ComicImpact.com in April and in June was selected as Critiques4Geeks.com’s first ever ''Geek Babe of the Month''.<ref name=2011Comicon/>
Tate's 2010 ComicCon appearance also resulted in the publishing of her first book, ''Tanya Tate: My Life in Costume''.<ref name=20121stBook>{{cite web|last1=Staff|title=Product Review: Tanya Tate: My Life in Costume|url=http://sex-toys.avn.com/Tanya-Tate-My-Life-in-Costume-492423.html|website=AVN.com|publisher=Adult Video News|accessdate=24 June 2014}}</ref> Tate has become a contributing writer for the websites WorldOfSuperheroes.com<ref>{{cite web|last=Staff|title=Tanya Tate – New Columnist!|url=http://www.worldofsuperheroes.com/columnists/tanya-tate-new-columnist/|publisher=WorldofSuperHeroes.com|accessdate=11 February 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140224021014/http://www.worldofsuperheroes.com/columnists/tanya-tate-new-columnist/|archivedate=24 February 2014}}</ref> and Geekscape.net.<ref>{{cite web|last=Tate|first=Tanya|title=Disneyland’s Star Tours: The Adventure Continues Sneak Peek & Review|url=http://www.geekscape.net/disneylands-star-tours-the-adventure-continues-sneak-peek-review|publisher=www.geekscape.net|accessdate=11 February 2014}}</ref> In 2011, as part of her interest in cosplay and in conjunction with that year's ComicCon convention, Tate launched a costume design contest. The winning entrant won a lunch date with Tanya during Comic-Con.<ref name=2011Comicon>{{cite web|last=Staff|title=Win a Lunch Date with Tanya Tate at Comic-Con|url=http://business.avn.com/articles/video/Win-a-Lunch-Date-with-Tanya-Tate-at-Comic-Con-440124.html|publisher=Adult Video News|accessdate=11 February 2014}}</ref>
===Appearances=== In 2013, Tate was the cover model for the Turkish version of [[FHM magazine]].<ref>{{cite journal|last=Staff|title=crossover report|journal=Adult Video News|date=September 2013|page=22}}</ref> Also that year, she was featured in two documentaries. The first was [[Deborah Anderson]]'s feature documentary and accompanying [[art book]], ''[[Aroused (film)|Aroused]]''<ref>[http://thearousedproject.com/home.html The Aroused Project]. The Aroused Project.</ref> ({{ISBN|978-0-9893744-0-8}}), a theatre-released film profiled the lives of several adult industry performers during the production of Anderson’s photobook of the same name.<ref name=AVNDoc2013>{{cite web|last=Staff|title=UK TV About To Get a Taste of Tanya Tate in 'Date My Porn Star'|url=http://business.avn.com/articles/video/UK-TV-About-To-Get-a-Taste-of-Tanya-Tate-in-Date-My-Porn-Star-533519.html|publisher=Adult Video News|accessdate=11 February 2014}}</ref> It was released in cinemas in the US summer 2013 and internationally in January 2014.<ref name="spectator.co.uk">[http://www.spectator.co.uk/spectator-life/spectator-life-culture/8936331/a-career-in-sex/ Alison Wolf on power, politics and porn]. ''The Spectator'' (22 June 2013).</ref><ref>[http://frontrowfeatures.com/2013/04/adult-video-actresses-get-real-in-aroused/#!prettyPhoto Adult-Video Actresses Get Real in 'Aroused'] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140108182134/http://frontrowfeatures.com/2013/04/adult-video-actresses-get-real-in-aroused/ |date=8 January 2014 }}. Front Row Features (26 April 2013).</ref> The second was for the [[United Kingdom]]-broadcast [[Channel 4]] television show ''Date My Porn Star'', where a film crew accompanied one of Tate's fans from Britain to her home in Los Angeles to meet the performer.<ref name=AVNDoc2013/>
===Other ventures=== Since 2011 she has operated a cosplay-themed website and blog called justalottatanya.com.<ref>{{cite web|last=Staff|title=Whois|url=http://whois.domaintools.com/justalottatanya.com|publisher=Domain Tools|accessdate=10 January 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Staff|title=Tanya Tate Launches Free Cosplay Fansite, JustaLottaTanya.com|url=http://business.avn.com/articles/technology/Tanya-Tate-Launches-Free-Cosplay-Fansite-JustaLottaTanya-com-430131.html|publisher=Adult Video News|accessdate=11 February 2014}}</ref> Tate also operates a publicity company.<ref name=Publicist>{{cite web|last1=Harvey-Jenner|first1=Catriona|title=14 weird questions about life as a porn star, answered by professionals You're about to find out exactly what these pornstars tell their granny they do for work|url=http://www.cosmopolitan.co.uk/love-sex/sex/ask-cosmo/a28888/porn-questions-answered-professionals-tanya-tate-joybear/|website=Cosmopolitan UK|publisher=Hearst|accessdate=20 December 2014}}</ref>
In 2013, Tate began several partnerships and cooperative ventures. She announced a line of [[action figure]]s, unveiled a co-created comic book character, and syndicated blogs for HollywoodGoneGeek.com and FirstComicsNews.com.<ref>{{cite web|last=Staff|title=Tanya Tate Nom'd For MILF of the Year and Mainstream Crossover|url=http://business.avn.com/company-news/Tanya-Tate-Nom-d-For-MILF-of-the-Year-and-Mainstream-Crossover-538556.html|publisher=Adult Video News|accessdate=24 February 2014}}</ref> In April 2014, Tate's ''Lady Titan'' was introduced at that year's [[WonderCon]] pop-culture convention in [[Anaheim, California]].<ref name=2014LadyTitan>{{cite web|last=Staff|title=Tanya Tate to Promote 'Lady Titan' Comic Book at Wondercon|url=http://business.avn.com/company-news/Tanya-Tate-to-Promote-Lady-Titan-Comic-Book-at-Wondercon-556204.html|publisher=Adult Video News|accessdate=15 April 2014}}</ref>
In March 2014, a collaboration was announced between Tate and the newly launched ''cougars.xxx'' website owned by the [[Luxembourg]] based Lilly Devine SA company. CEO Moriam Hassan Balogun commented, "Tanya is not only an established professional with great ideas and a total understanding of what MILF fans want but also a major favourite within the industry".<ref name=2014Cougarsite>{{cite web|last=Staff|title=Tanya Tate Collaborates With New Cougars Website|url=http://business.avn.com/company-news/Tanya-Tate-Collaborates-With-New-Cougars-Website-552700.html|publisher=Adult Video News|accessdate=11 May 2014}}</ref> Then in April 2014, Tate began hosting a live weekly radio show on the [[Vivid radio]] channel of the [[Sirius XM Radio]] network called the ''Tanya Tate Show''.<ref name=2014VividRadio>{{cite web|last=Staff|title='Tanya Tate Show' Launches On Vivid Radio Today|url=http://business.avn.com/company-news/Tanya-Tate-Show-Launches-On-Vivid-Radio-Today-557514.html|publisher=Adult Video News|accessdate=11 May 2014}}</ref>
Tate debuted her latest line of action figures, a customizable vinyl figure line called My Hero Toys, in October 2014. The new line of figures was announced at [[Stan Lee]]'s annual event, the [[Comikaze Expo]] in Los Angeles.<ref name=2014vinyl>{{cite web|title=Cosplay Star TANYA TATE Debuts My Hero Toys Vinyl Figure Line At Stan Lee’s Comikaze!|url=http://www.prurgent.com/2014-10-30/pressrelease365019.htm|website=PRurgent.com|publisher=PR Urgent|accessdate=20 December 2014}}</ref>
==Advocacy== In 2012, Tate appeared on behalf of the [[Free Speech Coalition]] at a [[press conference]] for the [[MindGeek#No on Government Waste Committee|"No on Government Waste" Committee]], which opposed [[Los Angeles County]]'s [[Measure B]]; the mandatory condom and health permit initiative.<ref name=PressCon>{{cite web|last=Kernes|first=Mark|title='No on Government Waste' Committee Holds 1st Press Conference Supporters include Valley Industry and Commerce Association and several Chambers of Commerce|url=http://business.avn.com/articles/legal/No-on-Government-Waste-Committee-Holds-1st-Press-Conference-488400.html|publisher=Adult Video News|accessdate=11 February 2014}}</ref>{{irrelevant citation|date=November 2015|reason=Citation bears no relation to quote.}}
With regard to Measure B, Tate was quoted in a San Fernando Valley Business Journal article to the effect that she would want whomever she decided to have sex with "to get tested until I felt comfortable to sleep with them without a condom," adding that [[AIDS Healthcare Foundation]] president Michael Weinstein (whom the article was about), "should be spending money on treating [AIDS] and educating regular people about how to protect themselves instead of going after a small community that is aware of the risks".<ref name=PressCon/>
In response to [[Samuel Jackson]]'s comments about [[RedTube]], the free porn-sharing website, at a May press conference for his 2014 movie ''[[Captain America: The Winter Soldier]]'', Tate said that piracy impacts her directly because she produces her own web content. She stated, "I would gladly send a catalog of adult movies I have directed to Mr. Jackson if he would be so kind as to recant the comment".<ref>{{cite web|title=Samuel L. Jackson Stop Promoting Free Porn ...Say Angry XXX Actors |url=http://www.tmz.com/2014/05/01/samuel-l-jackson-steal-porn-redtube-xxx-nick-fuy-boycott/|website=TMZ.com|publisher=TMZ|accessdate=20 December 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Sullivan|first1=Gail|title=Here’s how Samuel L. Jackson started a porn piracy backlash|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/morning-mix/wp/2014/05/12/heres-how-samuel-l-jackson-started-a-porn-piracy-backlash/|website=Washington Post|publisher=Washington Post|accessdate=20 December 2014}}</ref>
In December 2014, Tate was outspoken regarding [[Internet censorship in the United Kingdom|new regulations]] imposed on online content in the United Kingdom. In an interview she stated, "[[Female ejaculation]] being banned is not only a slap in the face to women across the UK, but proof that men making these rules do not see women as equals. The lads can enjoy a good pop shot, but should a woman come, all hell breaks loose". Another item listed as banned content was "[[Role-playing]] as non-adults" which prompted Tate to state, "Can you say, 'Oh you're a naughty boy?' Or can you not say that because you cannot role-play as non-adults? Can you call someone a 'naughty boy' or do you have to say 'naughty man?' Who is going to monitor this?"<ref name=2014UKcensor>{{cite web|title=The UK’s War on Porn: ‘Proof That Men Making These Rules Do Not See Women as Equals’|url=http://www.thedailybeast.com/articles/2014/12/06/the-uk-s-war-on-porn-proof-that-men-making-these-rules-do-not-see-women-as-equals.html|website=www.thedailybeast.com|publisher=IAC|accessdate=20 December 2014}}</ref>

Retrieved 5 March 2012.</ref> She is also a lifelong fan of [[Liverpool Football Club]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LMjawI5mtUU |title=TANYA TATE™ Shares Thoughts On The Hillsborough Disaster |publisher=YouTube |date=30 September 2012 |accessdate=29 December 2013}}</ref> She is a cosplay enthusiast and uses an [[alter ego]] by the name of ''Lady Titan''.<ref>{{cite In June 2017 she announced she was pregnant. web|last=Tate|first=Tanya|title=JustAlottaTanya|url=http://www.justalottatanya.com/|accessdate=10 January 2014}}</ref> Tate announced her pregnancy on 16 June 2017.<ref>[https://twitter.com/TanyaTate/status/875818511959941121]</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starfactorypr.com/2017/06/pr-tanya-tate-announces-pregnancy-and-opens-up-about-ivf-to-irelands-sunday-world.html|title=#PR: TANYA TATE Announces Pregnancy And Opens Up About IVF To Ireland’s Sunday World|publisher=StarFactoryPR |date=16 June 2017 |accessdate=16 June 2017}}</ref> She tweeted that she gave birth to a boy on 30 November 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/TanyaTate/status/936507531584724993|title=Tanya Tate on Twitter: "Welcome Oswald Alexander aka baby Ozzie to the world. {{Multiple issues| {{more footnotes|date=July 2013}} {{refimprove|date=July 2013}} }} {{Infobox radio station |name = The Pip, 8S1Shch |image = |city = |area = [[Southern Europe]] |branding = |slogan = |frequency = {{Frequency|5448|kHz}} (day)
{{Frequency|3756|kHz}} (night) |translator = |repeater = |airdate = 1985 |share = |share as of = |share source = |format = Repeated beeps, occasional voice messages |language = [[Russian language|Russian]] |power = |erp = |haat = |class = |facility_id = |coordinates = |callsign_meaning = |former_callsigns = |former_frequencies = |affiliations = [[Russian Armed Forces]] (unconfirmed) |owner = |licensee = |sister_stations = [[UVB-76|The Buzzer]], [[The Squeaky Wheel]] |webcast = |website = }} '''The Pip''' is the nickname given by [[shortwave listening|radio listeners]] to a [[shortwave]] [[radio station]] that broadcasts on the frequency 5448 [[kHz]] by day, and 3756 kHz during the night.{{cite web|url=http://www.numbers-stations.com/the-pip|title=The Pip|work=www.numbers-stations.com|accessdate=25 October 2014}}{{cite web |url=http://priyom.org/media/56944/the_pip_dossier.pdf |title=The Pip Dossier |accessdate= |author= |authorlink= |coauthors= |date=25 April 2013 |format=PDF |work= |publisher=Priyom.org }} It broadcasts short, repeated beeps at a rate of around 50 per minute, for 24 hours per day. The beep signal is occasionally interrupted for voice messages in Russian. The Pip has been active since around 1986, when its distinctive beeping sound was first recorded by listeners. The station is commonly referred to as "The Pip" among English-speaking radio listeners. In Russia, it is known as {{lang|ru|Капля}} (Kaplya) "the drop". While its official name or callsign is not known, some of the voice transmissions begin with the code '''8S1Shch''' (Cyrillic: {{lang|ru|8С1Щ}}), which is generally considered to be the name of the station. However, this code may not be a callsign, but instead serve some other purpose. Radioscanner.ru identifies the owner of this station as a North-Caucasian military district communication center with callsign "Akacia" (ex-72nd communication center, Russian "72 узел связи штаба СКВО") ==Format== [[File:The-pip-russia-12-07-2015-3756khz-2235.wav|thumb|A recording of the Pip during its normal operation, as heard in [[Russia]] on 12 July 2015.]] The station's format resembles, in many ways, that of its presumed sister station, [[The Buzzer]]. Its signal consists of short beeping sounds that repeat at a rate of approximately 50 beeps per minute.{{cite web|url=http://priyom.org/media/53334/s30_sample.ogg|title=Example recording of The Pip|author=Priyom.org|accessdate=2013-04-05|format=[[Ogg|OGG]]; 104 kB}} It is transmitted on the frequency 5448 kHz during the day and 3756 kHz at night. The times at which the station switches from the day to the night frequency or vice versa are changed over the course of the year, presumably to match the changing lengths of day and night.{{cite web|url=http://www.brogers.dsl.pipex.com/enigma2000/docs/ECL.pdf#page=12&zoom=auto,0,668|title=Enigma 2000 Control List|author=Enigma 2000|accessdate=2013-04-04|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121207073213/http://www.brogers.dsl.pipex.com/enigma2000/docs/ECL.pdf#page=12&zoom=auto,0,668|archivedate=2012-12-07|df=}} Higher frequencies have better [[Radio propagation|propagation]] characteristics during the day, while lower frequencies do better in darkness. ===Voice messages=== As with The Buzzer, the beeps are sometimes interrupted for the transmission of coded voice messages. There are two different message formats. Messages beginning with the Russian word {{lang|ru|для}} (dlya, "for") are thought to be test messages to gauge reception quality. The message itself consists of ten callsigns, each consisting of four numbers or letters. For example: Для ЙХЬЙ ЗЬ1Б НИ9В ДМЦ3 49ФТ Ц2ЗА ЛИ27 ИННЦ ЩГЙП 8ЦЩЙ (To JH'J Z'1B NI9V DMC3 49FT C2ZA LI27 INNC ShchGJP 8CShchJ) This is then followed with another "To" and then the callsigns are repeated again, concluding with {{lang|ru|Как слышно?}} (Kak slyshno?, "How do you hear?"). The callsigns are then repeated twice more, ending with {{lang|ru|Приём!}} (Priyom!, "Over!"). Another type of message begins with {{lang|ru|8С1Щ}} (8S1Shch), thought to be the station's own callsign. This is then followed by two digits, then three, a codeword in Russian, then four pairs of digits: 8С1Щ 73 373 ВДЕВАНИЕ 84 56 22 35 (8S1Shch 73 373 VDYeVANIE 84 56 22 35) The message is then repeated four more times, also finishing with {{lang|ru|Приём!}} (Priyom!, "Over!"). ==Purpose== The purpose of The Pip is not known, although there are many hypotheses. It is often suggested that The Pip is part of a larger radio relay or control system, which also includes [[UVB-76|The Buzzer]] and [[The Squeaky Wheel]], which both follow similar formats. In particular, activity on The Pip often used to be followed a few minutes later by a voice message on The Squeaky Wheel, suggesting that both are operated by the same organization and share the same purpose. On one occasion, The Pip's characteristic beeping sound could be heard in the background while a message was being transmitted on the Squeaky Wheel's frequency, which may indicate that both stations are even operated from within the same building or room.{{cite web|url=http://priyom.org/media/56605/s32-3828usb-20120105-1410z-msg-byavare.mp3|title=Message from The Squeaky wheel with The Pip heard in the background|author=Priyom.org|accessdate=2013-04-17|format=MP3; 1,7 MB}} However, these activities have since ceased. Later tables of received messages no longer show such parallels.{{cite web|url=http://priyom.org/media/56944/the_pip_dossier.pdf#page=8&zoom=auto,0,459|title=The Pip Dossier (page 8)|author=Priyom.org (user: Tucana)|accessdate=2013-04-16}} ==See also== {{Portal|Radio}} *[[Numbers station]] *[[DXing]] ==References== {{Reflist|2}} ==External links== * [http://www.numbers-stations.com/the-pip The Pip] * [http://priyom.org/number-stations/slavic/s30.aspx S30 - ''The Pip''] on Priyom.org * [http://www.brogers.dsl.pipex.com/page7.html ''The Pip'' - S30 (formerly XT)] * [http://danix111.cba.pl/ns/pip.html ''Pip'' Study Page] * [http://vk.com/akaciya ''vkontakte group for people who have completed military service in Akacia''] {{DEFAULTSORT:Pip}} [[Category:Radio in the Soviet Union]] [[Category:Radio in Russia]] [[Category:Secret broadcasting]]

{{notability|date=June 2012}}
'''Virtual Reality''' was the name of a series of six [[gamebooks]] released in 1993 and 1994. Four of the books were written by [[Dave Morris (writer)|Dave Morris]], and two by [[Mark Smith (author)|Mark Smith]].
==Game system== The game system used in the series is unusual for gamebooks, in that there is no use of dice or other random elements. Instead, the player picks a number of skills from a list, and may be directed to different paragraphs based on whether or not they have a particular skill. The list of skills is similar, but not identical, from one book to the next.
In addition, players may pick up different items and 'keywords', and these may also be used to direct players to different paragraphs, as in other gamebook series.
An example of a character sheet from the series may be found [http://www.gamebooks.org/scans/VirtualReality/vr5sheet.jpg here].
==Reprints== Dave Morris' 'Heart of Ice', which was highly regarded by many gamebook fans,{{who|date=July 2012}}{{citation needed|date=June 2012}} was reprinted in 2000 [http://www.gamebooks.org/show_item.php?id=2882]. The series is to be published in electronic format by [Osprey Publishing].<ref>http://fabledlands.blogspot.se/2013/01/worlds-of-if.html</ref>
